Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Summary:

We are seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for gathering, analyzing, and interpreting large datasets to support business decisions. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify trends, provide insights, and optimize business processes.

Key Responsibilities:

Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets to uncover trends and insights.
Develop reports, dashboards, and visualizations to present findings to stakeholders.
Work with business teams to define key performance indicators (KPIs) and track performance metrics.
Perform statistical analysis and predictive modeling to support decision-making.
Identify data-driven opportunities for business process improvements.
Maintain data integrity and ensure quality assurance in data reporting.
Collaborate with IT and engineering teams to streamline data collection and storage processes.
Stay up to date with industry trends and best practices in data analytics.

Required Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field.
2+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a similar role.
Proficiency in SQL for querying and data manipulation.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker.
Strong analytical skills with experience in Excel, Python, or R.
Ability to translate complex data insights into actionable business recommendations.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication and presentation skills.

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with machine learning models or predictive analytics.
Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure.
Understanding of ETL processes and data warehousing concepts.
Experience working with CRM, ERP, or marketing analytics platforms.

Why Join Us?

Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunity to work on impactful projects with a dynamic team.
Career growth and professional development opportunities.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Introduction: Join our client's dynamic team as a Data Analyst, where you will play a pivotal role in driving our business decisions through expert data analysis and reporting. Your proficiency in SQL, experience with Excel and PowerPoint, and ability to utilize data visualization tools will be key to your success in this role.

Key Responsibilities


Develop and execute complex SQL queries for ad hoc data analysis, helping our team to make informed decisions quickly.
Utilize Excel to extract data, create effective visualizations, and leverage PowerPoint to present these insights compellingly.
Work with data visualization tools such as MicroStrategy, Tableau, or PowerBI to understand and use MS reports efficiently. Gather and document requirements for new dashboards or enhancements to existing ones.
Collaborate cross-functionally with data engineers, product managers, business analysts, and business users to ensure cohesive communication and effective project outcomes.
Apply critical thinking to analyze datasets, ask pertinent questions, identify data discrepancies, and uncover insights that drive business strategy.
Maintain a high standard of data quality, ensuring that all reports provide accurate and reliable insights.


Qualifications


Proficiency in SQL with a strong understanding of writing and analyzing queries.
Experienced in using Excel for data manipulation and creating charts, along with proficiency in PowerPoint for storytelling through data.
Experience in data visualization and reporting with tools like MicroStrategy, Tableau, or PowerBI. Familiarity with MicroStrategy is a plus.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to work effectively across multiple teams.
Strong analytical skills with a keen eye for data quality and accuracy.

Title: L/S Data Analyst
Description:
A Career with Point72’s Long/Short Equities Team

Long/short equity is Point72’s largest investment strategy, and our success is dependent upon our investing teams, comprised of portfolio managers and research analysts.

What You’ll Do

As a data analyst embedded in an investing team, you will help drive innovation by leveraging a variety of data sources and systems. You will work directly with a portfolio manager and their team of research analysts to connect data and fundamental research. Your work will support investment theses and help inform investment decisions.


Work directly with a portfolio manager and a team of research analysts to analyze a broad universe of Compliance-approved data to directly influence idea generation and investment decisions, with an emphasis on equities.
Design, build, and maintain data products and predictive models that enable analysis of key performance indicators (KPIs) and forward-looking metrics relevant to your specific sector.
Investigate and explore innovative approaches to extract meaningful information from complex datasets.
Develop agile, automated systems that rapidly ingest, synthesize, and analyze diverse sets of information in real-time, producing actionable insights to support timely decision-making.
Optimize and scale existing data infrastructure to enhance performance, reliability, and adaptability in handling complex, high-volume data streams.
Develop and maintain high-quality, efficient, and modular code, creating well-documented custom libraries and data pipelines that enhance the team's analytical capabilities and ensure reproducibility of results.
Stay on top of the newest technologies approved for use across the firm.
Partner with Compliance on all aspects such as approved data sources, permissibility of systems, and analytics.


What’s Required


Undergraduate degree or higher.
Quantitative ability as demonstrated through relevant coursework or work equivalent.
Experience working with diverse data types including structured, unstructured (e.g., text), and time-series data.
Strong understanding of statistical concepts and their application to large-scale data analysis, with an interest in applying these skills to financial datasets.
Strong coding skills in a high-level programming language (e.g., SQL, Python, R, or similar). Familiarity with version control systems (such as Git) and collaborative development practices. Ability to comprehend, navigate, and expand existing code bases.
Strong data visualization skills, with experience in creating informative visualizations using coding languages like Python or R.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to approach complex issues systematically and creatively. Demonstrated capacity to translate business questions into data-driven solutions.
Demonstrated interest in AI applications and experience using widely available AI tools and platform.
Team player with an entrepreneurial spirit and good communication skills.
Deep intellectual curiosity and lifelong-learning mindset.
Commitment to the highest ethical standards.


We Take Care of Our People

We invest in our people, their careers, their health, and their well-being. When you work here, we provide:


Fully-paid health care benefits
Generous parental and family leave policies
Mental and physical wellness programs
Volunteer opportunities
Non-profit matching gift program
Support for employee-led affinity groups representing women, minorities and the LGBTQ+ community
Tuition assistance
A 401(k) savings program with an employer match and more


About Point72

Point72 is a leading global alternative investment firm led by Steven A. Cohen. Building on more than 30 years of investing experience, Point72 seeks to deliver superior returns for its investors through fundamental and systematic investing strategies across asset classes and geographies. We aim to attract and retain the industry’s brightest talent by cultivating an investor-led culture and committing to our people’s long-term growth. For more information, visit www.Point72.com/about.

The annual base salary range for this role is $150,000-$180,000 (USD) , which does not include discretionary bonus compensation or our comprehensive benefits package. Actual compensation offered to the successful candidate may vary from posted hiring range based upon geographic location, work experience, education, and/or skill level, among other things.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Why Join CINQCARE?

CINQCARE is a provider-led, community-based health and care partner dedicated to improving the health and well-being of those who need care the most, with a deep commitment to high-needs, urban and rural communities. Our local physicians, nurses, and caregivers work together to serve people and the communities they live in, beyond just treating symptoms. We remove barriers by delivering personalized care as close to home as possible, often in-home, because we know a deep understanding of our patient’s race, culture, and environment is critical to delivering improved health outcomes. By empowering patients, providers, and caregivers with the support they need, we strive to make health and care a reality—not a burden—every single day. Join us in creating a better way to care.

Position Overview

The Data Analyst reports to the Senior Director Clinical Informatics to help ensure that health and care providers have the tools and information they need to deliver high-quality services. This position will assist in being responsible for standard and ad-hoc reporting and insights using some or all the following as needed to gain accurate insights: external sources, the company’s data warehouse, EHR, clinical decision support systems, and telemedicine platforms. The Data Analyst should embody CINQCARE’s core values, including, Trusted, Empathetic, Committed, Humble, Creative and Community-Minded.

Key Responsibilities

The Data Analyst will have the following responsibilities:


Work closely with the data warehouse team to ensure and maintain the accuracy and completeness of clinical data.
Interpret data and draw conclusions on clinical performance, practice performance and financial performance with regards to medical management and quality.
Support clinical and practice performance teams to ensure clear data interpretation and performance tracking
Help establish protocols for data entry, storage, and retrieval ensuring that patient data is reliable and secure.
Leverage data analytics to improve patient outcomes and operational efficiency by analyzing trends in patient care and identifying areas for improvement
Develop a data governance methodology to ensure consistent and reliable data management practices
Collaborate and proactively communicate with cross-functional stakeholders, providers, administrators, technology services, clinical operations, clinical care, network, and external vendors
Provide support to the clinical team ensuring they have the necessary resources, training, and guidance to perform their roles efficiently


General Duties

The Data Analyst Should Have The Following Duties


Leadership: The Data Analyst will help in defining and executing strategies and solutions to create business value in working on a team to design, develop, and execute strategies and solutions to deliver desired outcomes.
Strategy: The Data Analyst will establish the business strategy and roadmap improved outcomes for members, enhance the efficacy of business divisions, and help develop to deliver external market opportunities for products and services. In assisting to establish the business strategy, the Data Analyst will help define and innovate sustainable revenue models to drive profitability to the company.
Collaboration: The Data Analyst will help ensure capabilities form a cohesive offering, including working closely with other business divisions to learn their needs, internalizing their knowledge, and defining solutions to achieve the business objectives.
Knowledge: The Data Analyst will provide expertise to help in determining and recommending approaches for solution deployment and performance evaluation.


Required Qualifications

The Data Analyst should have the following qualifications:


Bachelor's degree in healthcare administration, business administration, finance, or related field
Minimum 3 years healthcare informatics experience
Understanding of healthcare IT systems, including EHRs clinical decision support systems, and data analytics platforms
Proficient with programming languages, database management, and network security
Knowledge of clinical workflows and healthcare practices including medical terminology, clinical guidelines, and patient care protocols
Analytical skills interpreting data and developing insights to improve patient outcomes and operational efficiency
Proficiency in strategic planning, project management methodologies, and tools
Effective communication skills including the ability to translate technical information into understandable terms for non-technical audiences
Experience developing and delivering user-training programs and technical support guidance


Our Benefits

At CINQCARE, we care for our team like we care for our patients—holistically. We offer flexible, comprehensive benefits so you can thrive while delivering top-notch care.


Medical Plans: Two options, including a $0 cost plan for individuals.
401K: 4% employer match for your future.
Dental & Vision: Flexible plans with in-network savings.
Paid Time Off: Generous PTO, holidays, and wellness time.
Extras: Pet insurance, commuter benefits, mileage reimbursement, CME for providers, and company-provided phones for field staff.


The working environment and physical requirements of the job include:

Work is performed indoors in a setting with conditioned air and artificial light. Travel to and work in offices or other environments is required.

In this position you will need an to communicate with customers, vendors, management, and other co-workers in person and over devices, sometimes with people who are agitated. Regular use of the telephone and e-mail for communication is essential. Sitting for extended periods is common. Must be able to receive ordinary information and to prepare or inspect documents. Lifting of up to 10 lbs. occasionally may be required. Good manual dexterity for the use of common office equipment such as computer terminals, calculator, copiers, and FAX machines. Good reasoning ability is important. Able to understand and utilize management reports, memos, and other documents to conduct business.

Compensation: From $60,000 to $70,000 per year
Show more
HTML:
Why Join CINQCARE?

CINQCARE is a provider-led, community-based health and care partner dedicated to improving the health and well-being of those who need care the most, with a deep commitment to high-needs, urban and rural communities. Our local physicians, nurses, and caregivers work together to serve people and the communities they live in, beyond just treating symptoms. We remove barriers by delivering personalized care as close to home as possible, often in-home, because we know a deep understanding of our patient’s race, culture, and environment is critical to delivering improved health outcomes. By empowering patients, providers, and caregivers with the support they need, we strive to make health and care a reality—not a burden—every single day. Join us in creating a better way to care.

Position Overview

The Data Analyst reports to the Senior Director Clinical Informatics to help ensure that health and care providers have the tools and information they need to deliver high-quality services. This position will assist in being responsible for standard and ad-hoc reporting and insights using some or all the following as needed to gain accurate insights: external sources, the company’s data warehouse, EHR, clinical decision support systems, and telemedicine platforms. The Data Analyst should embody CINQCARE’s core values, including, Trusted, Empathetic, Committed, Humble, Creative and Community-Minded.

Key Responsibilities

The Data Analyst will have the following responsibilities:

  • Work closely with the data warehouse team to ensure and maintain the accuracy and completeness of clinical data.
  • Interpret data and draw conclusions on clinical performance, practice performance and financial performance with regards to medical management and quality.
  • Support clinical and practice performance teams to ensure clear data interpretation and performance tracking
  • Help establish protocols for data entry, storage, and retrieval ensuring that patient data is reliable and secure.
  • Leverage data analytics to improve patient outcomes and operational efficiency by analyzing trends in patient care and identifying areas for improvement
  • Develop a data governance methodology to ensure consistent and reliable data management practices
  • Collaborate and proactively communicate with cross-functional stakeholders, providers, administrators, technology services, clinical operations, clinical care, network, and external vendors
  • Provide support to the clinical team ensuring they have the necessary resources, training, and guidance to perform their roles efficiently

General Duties

The Data Analyst Should Have The Following Duties

  • Leadership: The Data Analyst will help in defining and executing strategies and solutions to create business value in working on a team to design, develop, and execute strategies and solutions to deliver desired outcomes.
  • Strategy: The Data Analyst will establish the business strategy and roadmap improved outcomes for members, enhance the efficacy of business divisions, and help develop to deliver external market opportunities for products and services. In assisting to establish the business strategy, the Data Analyst will help define and innovate sustainable revenue models to drive profitability to the company.
  • Collaboration: The Data Analyst will help ensure capabilities form a cohesive offering, including working closely with other business divisions to learn their needs, internalizing their knowledge, and defining solutions to achieve the business objectives.
  • Knowledge: The Data Analyst will provide expertise to help in determining and recommending approaches for solution deployment and performance evaluation.

Required Qualifications

The Data Analyst should have the following qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in healthcare administration, business administration, finance, or related field
  • Minimum 3 years healthcare informatics experience
  • Understanding of healthcare IT systems, including EHRs clinical decision support systems, and data analytics platforms
  • Proficient with programming languages, database management, and network security
  • Knowledge of clinical workflows and healthcare practices including medical terminology, clinical guidelines, and patient care protocols
  • Analytical skills interpreting data and developing insights to improve patient outcomes and operational efficiency
  • Proficiency in strategic planning, project management methodologies, and tools
  • Effective communication skills including the ability to translate technical information into understandable terms for non-technical audiences
  • Experience developing and delivering user-training programs and technical support guidance

Our Benefits

At CINQCARE, we care for our team like we care for our patients—holistically. We offer flexible, comprehensive benefits so you can thrive while delivering top-notch care.

  • Medical Plans: Two options, including a $0 cost plan for individuals.
  • 401K: 4% employer match for your future.
  • Dental & Vision: Flexible plans with in-network savings.
  • Paid Time Off: Generous PTO, holidays, and wellness time.
  • Extras: Pet insurance, commuter benefits, mileage reimbursement, CME for providers, and company-provided phones for field staff.

The working environment and physical requirements of the job include:

Work is performed indoors in a setting with conditioned air and artificial light. Travel to and work in offices or other environments is required.

In this position you will need an to communicate with customers, vendors, management, and other co-workers in person and over devices, sometimes with people who are agitated. Regular use of the telephone and e-mail for communication is essential. Sitting for extended periods is common. Must be able to receive ordinary information and to prepare or inspect documents. Lifting of up to 10 lbs. occasionally may be required. Good manual dexterity for the use of common office equipment such as computer terminals, calculator, copiers, and FAX machines. Good reasoning ability is important. Able to understand and utilize management reports, memos, and other documents to conduct business.

Compensation: From $60,000 to $70,000 per year

Title: Operations Data Analyst Intern - i-0048
Description:
Company Description

No Relocation Assistance Provided.

KIOXIA America, Inc. is the U.S.-based subsidiary of KIOXIA Corporation, a leading worldwide supplier of flash memory and solid state drives (SSDs). From the invention of flash memory to today’s breakthrough BiCS FLASH™ 3D flash memory technology, KIOXIA continues to pioneer innovative memory, SSD and software solutions that enrich people's lives and expand society's horizons. The company's innovative BiCS FLASH™ 3D flash memory technology is shaping the future of storage in high-density applications, including advanced smartphones, PCs, SSDs, automotive, and data centers.

Job Description

We are looking for a highly motivated and person to help improve the efficiency of our internal business data processes. Our company works with various data sources, some of which require integration, cleaning, and preparation before analysis. In this role, you will help design and implement a reporting infrastructure that is easy to use, error-proof, and largely automated.

This is a great opportunity for a student with a data analysis and business analytics background who is eager to work on real-world business problems. You will play a critical role in setting up a data preparation process that automates data cleaning, mapping, and operations, ensuring more efficient decision-making across the company.

Key Responsibilities


Work with multiple internal data sources to structure, clean, and integrate data for analysis.
Develop automated processes to handle data preparation and reduce manual efforts.
Write SQL queries and/or use programming skills (Python, R, etc.) to manage and process data.
Collaborate with teams in demand planning, finance, pricing, logistics, and IT to understand business needs and ensure data consistency.
Support the creation of dashboards and reports that provide clear, actionable insights.
Identify opportunities to streamline data workflows and improve overall efficiency.
Regularly report progress to management, providing updates on data integration, automation, and insights.



Qualifications


Major in Business, Data Science, Statistics, Operations Management, or a related field.
Prior internship/corporate experience
Experience with SQL and data querying; programming skills (Python, R, or similar) are a plus.
Proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, or Looker).
Familiarity with ERP, CRM, or other operational tools is an advantage.
Strong understanding of data analytics, database design, and business intelligence.
Familiarity with data cleaning, transformation, and visualization tools.
Experience in data analysis, business analytics, or a similar role.
Experience with operational processes, workflows, or supply chain management is a plus.
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking abilities.
Collaborative and detail-oriented mindset.
Excellent communication skills for presenting insights to both technical and non-technical audiences.



Additional Information

Req# i-0048;

The expected salary for this position is $30 - $35/hour.

At KIOXIA, we value the following:


Investment in you
Offering opportunities for career growth and personal development training
Open-minded management
Empowering employees by listening and responding to ideas, issues, and approaches
Flexible work-life balance
Offering a generous PTO allotment, holiday shutdown, and flexible work options
Diversity of cultures, perspectives, backgrounds and experiences of all our team members
Through our diversity, equity and inclusion initiatives, our focus is to strengthen our company culture to create more inclusion and belonging for all
Benefits for our team members
Excellent medical and non-medical benefits, 401(k) matching, pet insurance



KIOXIA America, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analytics

Conduct analysis, interpret data and offer action-driven recommendations and insights to executive leaders and managers on the basis of results.
Partner with teams across the bank to determine data needs and design dashboards and reports that are concise and actionable
Understand demographics and banking segments to provide support in the development of strategy including business unit and customer profitability.
Make recommendations to management around process improvements and systems enhancements resulting from sound analysis of business process, data flow and other process transformation mediums.
Develop and apply statistical methods and experimentation to analyze the effect of pricing and sales decisions on business performance to support the Bank’s customer acquisition, cross-sell, and retention efforts.
Assist in the development of Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) bank-wide to be used by management to track trends and realign strategic priorities on an ongoing basis.
Prepare management and board reports that reconcile business activity to the Bank’s financials.
Work closely with internal and external teams to drive action and ensure accuracy and validity of each data source.
Mentor and train employees with regards to data visualization and predictive and forecasting tools.
Maintain, support, update and create Business Intelligence dashboards.

Non-Essential Functions:

Perform special projects, research and other duties as assigned.







Education and Experience:

Bachelor's degree in marketing, information science or related field, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Required:

Expert with data analytics
Knowledgeable in how to build and use several data analytic tools
Skilled in updating various databases
Exceptional analytical and logic skills

Preferred

Knowledge of MCIF database system management
Intermediate to advanced knowledge of report writing using Microsoft Power BI or a similar business intelligence tool.
Knowledge of statistical analysis and methodology
Advanced skill level in Excel
Strong understanding of retail banking business financial drivers.




Physical Requirements:

Office Worker: Ability to stand, bend, stoop, sit, walk, twist and turn. Ability to lift up to 15 pounds




Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

• Experience working with data stored across multiple databases/data sources

Title: Data Product Analyst
Description:
Radicle Health acquires, invests, and operates mission critical human services software (SaaS) companies. We believe that human services agencies and the people they serve deserve functional, modern, and easy-to-use software. And we believe we're the ones to build it. Radicle Health is backed by Alpine Software Group (ASG), a leading private equity investor in vertical SaaS businesses.

The Data Product Analyst will be a key member of our product team, owning and evolving our DataStudio platform. This role requires a blend of data analytics expertise, data infrastructure thought partnership, product stewardship, and customer-centric communication. The ideal candidate has strong SQL skills, experience working with data warehouses (preferably Snowflake), a knack for translating raw data into meaningful dashboards and reports, and an interest in developing lightweight product management skills. Approximately 20% of their time will be spent directly interacting with customers to train, support, and guide them on data and analytics best practices.

Key Responsibilities:


Write advanced SQL queries to analyze data within Snowflake and create/manage dashboards, reports, and visualizations for internal stakeholders (e.g., billing team) and external customers, possibly leveraging BI tools.
Own and fulfill data requests from both external parties (e.g., advocacy groups, coalitions) and internal teams (e.g., product, operations), providing data-driven insights to inform key decisions while ensuring data integrity, quality, and accessibility.
Serve as the go-to expert on the data product, deeply understanding tools (currently Snowflake + Sisense), managing configurations, and collaborating with engineers and the product team to optimize infrastructure, transformations, and sustainability.
Ensure that all data products, analyses, and dashboards remain PHI-compliant and meet security/privacy standards such as HIPAA.
Collaborate with the Group Product Manager and engineering team to define product vision and roadmap goals for DataStudio, aligning initiatives with business objectives and customer needs while overseeing execution, delivery, and platform maintenance (including version updates and performance tuning).
Train customers and internal stakeholders on dashboards, reports, and BI tools, tailoring sessions to technical skill levels, and addressing support tickets related to data quality, reporting issues, or dashboard configuration.
Provide guidance during data implementations to ensure seamless customer onboarding and maintain comprehensive documentation on available reports, dashboards, and best practices.
Contribute to internal knowledge bases, ensuring teams have clear, up-to-date references for all data-related workflows and policies.


Qualifications:


3+ years of experience in a data analytics role, ideally within a SaaS or technology-focused environment.
Proficiency in SQL (complex joins, subqueries, advanced transformations) and direct experience with Snowflake or similar cloud-based data warehouses.
Familiarity with Sisense or other BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Demonstrated ability to build dashboards and BI solutions that inform strategic decisions.
Strong verbal and written communication skills, with an ability to explain complex data concepts to non-technical audiences.
An interest in product management principles—understanding user needs, gathering feedback, and translating requirements into platform enhancements.
Prior healthcare software experience, preferred
Understanding of healthcare data and privacy standards such as HIPAA compliance, preferred
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Information Systems, Statistics, or a related field preferred.


Other Information:


Compensation: $100,000-130,000 base salary
Location: Remote
Benefits: 401k matching, medical, dental and vision healthcare coverage, unlimited PTO, paid holidays, volunteer time off, paid parental leave, etc.


Salary ranges are dependent on a variety of factors, including qualifications, experience and geographic location. More information about the salary range specific to your working location and other factors will be shared during the hiring process.

Radicle Health is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. Radicle Health does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender-identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable local, state, or federal laws or prohibited by Company policy.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
BE PART OF BUILDING THE FUTURE.

What do NASA and emerging space companies have in common with COVID vaccine R&D teams or with Roblox and the Metaverse?

The answer is data, -- all fast moving, fast growing industries rely on data for a competitive edge in their industries. And the most advanced companies are realizing the full data advantage by partnering with Pure Storage. Pure’s vision is to redefine the storage experience and empower innovators by simplifying how people consume and interact with data. With 11,000+ customers including 58% of the Fortune 500, we’ve only scratched the surface of our ambitions.

Pure Is Blazing Trails And Setting Records


For ten straight years, Gartner has named Pure a leader in the Magic Quadrant
Our customer-first culture and unwavering commitment to innovation have earned us a certified Net Promoter Score in the top 1% of B2B companies globally
Industry analysts and press applaud Pure’s leadership across these dimensions
And, our 5,000+ employees are emboldened to make Pure a faster, stronger, smarter company as we go


If you, like us, say “bring it on” to exciting challenges that change the world, we have endless opportunities where you can make your mark.

SHOULD YOU ACCEPT THIS CHALLENGE...


Manage the development process of dashboards including requirements gathering, development, testing, and delivery
Gather and document requirements from stakeholders, accurately analyze and translate business requirements into technical ones
Develop executive ready reporting and visualizations to provide easy to digest actions out of complex problems
Help define a roadmap and vision for Business Insights and Data Strategy for business stakeholders
Present work to functional leaders and executives on a regular basis. Anticipate business questions by proactively developing targeted analysis
Communicate regularly with stakeholders to set expectations and progress of current development work
Work closely with development team to ensure alignment with business requirements and understanding of project goals and timeline
Participate in data warehouse design and optimization
Developing and maintaining key project governance documentation to ensure the proper amount of structure is applied for project success
Assist in assessment and recommendation of the BI tool ecosystem and data tech stack
Manage the delivery of finished products including: training and support to end users, access control to ensure successful adoption of dashboards


What You’ll Need To Bring To This Role...


5 -10 years of experience in/or supporting Sales or Revenue Operations. Experience with Salesforce is a plus
4+ years of experience in Tableau (or similar BI tools) used for business reporting and analytics
Experience working with SQL or other data manipulation languages. Familiarity with Snowflake is a plus
High proficiency in Excel/Google Sheets
BA degree required (degrees in business, financial or analytical fields)
Ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously, work well under pressure and adapt quickly to change.
Ability to partner cross-functionally, through strong relationship building, influencing, negotiating and communication skills, with all levels of management.
Self-motivated curiosity, sense of urgency, ability to pivot seamlessly between big picture and fine level granularity, and relentless focus on outcomes not activity
Excellent analytical, decision-making, project management, and financial modeling abilities.
Strong communication and “story-telling” skills, particularly to executive management.
Experience developing with iPaaS tools a plus
Must be eligible to work in the United States without visa sponsorship


You will be based in Chicago or Santa Clara. As this is an office-centric role, you are expected to be present in the office for 3 days a week. As outlined in Pure's Hybrid Work Policy, there will be variations over periods of time, depending on business need.

The annual base salary range is: Santa Clara $145,000.00 – $218,000.00

Salary ranges are determined based on role, level and location. For positions open to candidates in multiple geographical locations, the base salary range is reflective of the labor market across the applicable locations.

This role may be eligible for incentive pay and/or equity.

And because we understand the value of bringing your full and best self to work, we offer a variety of perks to manage a healthy balance, including flexible time off, wellness resources, and company-sponsored team events - check out purebenefits.com for more information.

There is no application deadline and we accept applications on an ongoing basis until the job is filled.

,

BE YOU—CORPORATE CLONES NEED NOT APPLY.

Pure is where you ask big questions, think differently, and make an impact. This is not just a job, but a place where you have a voice and can accelerate your career. We value unique thoughts and celebrate individuality, and with ample opportunity to learn, develop yourself, and expand into different roles, joining Pure is an investment in your career journey.

Through our Pure Equality program, which supports a flourishing field of employee resource groups, we nourish the personal and professional lives of our team members. And our Pure Good Foundation gives back to local and global communities through volunteering and grants.

And because we understand the value of bringing your full and best self to work, we offer a variety of perks to manage a healthy balance, including flexible time off, wellness resources, and company-sponsored team events.

PURE IS COMMITTED TO EQUALITY.

Research shows that in order to apply for a job, women feel they need to meet 100% of the criteria while men usually apply after meeting about 60%. Regardless of how you identify, if you believe you can do the job and are a good match, we encourage you to apply.

Pure is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or any other characteristic legally protected by the laws of the jurisdiction in which you are being considered for hire.

If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at TA-Ops@purestorage.com.

APPLICANT & CANDIDATE PERSONAL INFORMATION PRIVACY NOTICE.

If you're wondering how or why Pure collects or uses information you provide, we invite you to check out our Applicant & Candidate Personal Information Protection Notice.

DEEMED EXPORT LICENSE NOTICE.

Some positions may require a deemed export license for compliance with applicable laws and regulations. Please note: Pure does not currently sponsor deemed export license applications so we are unable to proceed with applicants requiring stated sponsorship.

BE PART OF BUILDING THE FUTURE.

What do NASA and emerging space companies have in common with COVID vaccine R&D teams or with Roblox and the Metaverse?

The answer is data, -- all fast moving, fast growing industries rely on data for a competitive edge in their industries. And the most advanced companies are realizing the full data advantage by partnering with Pure Storage. Pure’s vision is to redefine the storage experience and empower innovators by simplifying how people consume and interact with data. With 11,000+ customers including 58% of the Fortune 500, we’ve only scratched the surface of our ambitions.

Pure Is Blazing Trails And Setting Records

  • For ten straight years, Gartner has named Pure a leader in the Magic Quadrant
  • Our customer-first culture and unwavering commitment to innovation have earned us a certified Net Promoter Score in the top 1% of B2B companies globally
  • Industry analysts and press applaud Pure’s leadership across these dimensions
  • And, our 5,000+ employees are emboldened to make Pure a faster, stronger, smarter company as we go

If you, like us, say “bring it on” to exciting challenges that change the world, we have endless opportunities where you can make your mark.

SHOULD YOU ACCEPT THIS CHALLENGE...

  • Manage the development process of dashboards including requirements gathering, development, testing, and delivery
  • Gather and document requirements from stakeholders, accurately analyze and translate business requirements into technical ones
  • Develop executive ready reporting and visualizations to provide easy to digest actions out of complex problems
  • Help define a roadmap and vision for Business Insights and Data Strategy for business stakeholders
  • Present work to functional leaders and executives on a regular basis. Anticipate business questions by proactively developing targeted analysis
  • Communicate regularly with stakeholders to set expectations and progress of current development work
  • Work closely with development team to ensure alignment with business requirements and understanding of project goals and timeline
  • Participate in data warehouse design and optimization
  • Developing and maintaining key project governance documentation to ensure the proper amount of structure is applied for project success
  • Assist in assessment and recommendation of the BI tool ecosystem and data tech stack
  • Manage the delivery of finished products including: training and support to end users, access control to ensure successful adoption of dashboards

What You’ll Need To Bring To This Role...

  • 5 -10 years of experience in/or supporting Sales or Revenue Operations. Experience with Salesforce is a plus
  • 4+ years of experience in Tableau (or similar BI tools) used for business reporting and analytics
  • Experience working with SQL or other data manipulation languages. Familiarity with Snowflake is a plus
  • High proficiency in Excel/Google Sheets
  • BA degree required (degrees in business, financial or analytical fields)
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously, work well under pressure and adapt quickly to change.
  • Ability to partner cross-functionally, through strong relationship building, influencing, negotiating and communication skills, with all levels of management.
  • Self-motivated curiosity, sense of urgency, ability to pivot seamlessly between big picture and fine level granularity, and relentless focus on outcomes not activity
  • Excellent analytical, decision-making, project management, and financial modeling abilities.
  • Strong communication and “story-telling” skills, particularly to executive management.
  • Experience developing with iPaaS tools a plus
  • Must be eligible to work in the United States without visa sponsorship

You will be based in Chicago or Santa Clara. As this is an office-centric role, you are expected to be present in the office for 3 days a week. As outlined in Pure's Hybrid Work Policy, there will be variations over periods of time, depending on business need.

The annual base salary range is: Santa Clara $145,000.00 – $218,000.00

Title: Sr. Data Analyst-Marketing
Description:
About Semgrep

Our mission is to make world-class software security available to everyone. This means building program analysis tools that are open source, easy to use, powerful, and fast. It also means building a team with security expertise and a passion for great developer experiences. Most of all, it means working with honesty and respect in a diverse community of dreamers and builders. We’ve redefined static analysis tooling by committing to all of these, and turned our project, Semgrep, into an essential safeguard for code at Snowflake, Dropbox, and more.

About The Role

As a Senior Data Analyst working with the Marketing and Revenue Marketing team, you’ll be instrumental in shaping data-driven marketing strategies that drive measurable growth across our revenue organization, including demand generation, channel partnerships, and sales. In this role, you’ll build and optimize data infrastructure that delivers actionable insights, empowering the team to make high-impact, data-informed decisions. Leveraging advanced analytics and predictive modeling, you’ll help forecast marketing trends and inform strategic investment choices. You’ll also take ownership of data integrity, working closely with marketing operations to ensure quality data collection and analysis. A cross-functional role across our Data and Marketing teams, you’ll play a pivotal role in aligning analytics with our marketing vision and maximizing campaign effectiveness through experimentation and robust KPI tracking. Growth opportunities include embedding deeper into the Marketing team, expanding into analytical work with our Product & Engineering teams, or growing more technically into Data Engineering and Data Science roles.

What You'll Achieve


Build and Automate Reporting Solutions: Work with leaders across marketing and revenue teams to create easy-to-use reporting tools that promote transparency and accountability. Automate routine reports to give Revenue Operations clear, valuable insights and more time to focus on strategic work.
Drive Data-Backed Marketing Strategies: Use data to shape strategies in demand generation, account-based marketing (ABM), and channel partnerships. Set up performance metrics that guide smart decisions as we expand our marketing channels, ensuring our resources are used effectively.
Lead Customer Acquisition Forecasting: Own the customer acquisition forecast process within Revenue Operations, working closely with Finance to track progress toward goals. Use predictive analytics to anticipate trends and help the team stay ahead of changing customer needs.
Ensure Data Quality Across Systems: Partner with Business Systems to improve data quality and reliability, making sure all processes and tools work smoothly together. Take the lead in ensuring data accuracy and setting up reliable data collection and reporting practices.
Use Advanced Analytics to Improve Campaigns: Apply statistical methods like A/B testing to dig into campaign performance and find opportunities for improvement. Support marketing operations by helping optimize our technology setup so it can deliver clear, actionable insights for the team
Ensure Data Integrity and Quality: Build and maintain processes that guarantee high-quality, accurate data collection and reporting, serving as a key steward of data integrity within the revenue marketing team.
Drive Predictive Analytics and Modeling: Leverage advanced analytics and predictive modeling to forecast marketing trends, guiding strategy and anticipating customer needs.
Optimize Marketing Investments: Support budget optimization by providing data-backed analyses that inform resource allocation, helping prioritize initiatives with the greatest revenue impact.
Enhance Marketing Technology Stack: Collaborate with the marketing operations team to optimize our technology stack, ensuring it supports comprehensive analytics and seamless reporting.


You are ideal for this role if you have


3+ Years of Relevant Experience: Extensive experience in Data Analytics, Growth Analytics, or Business Intelligence, with a focus on leveraging data to drive strategic decisions. Experience working with or directly in Revenue Operations or Sales Operations teams such as building go-to-market (GTM) metrics or informing marketing strategies and sales initiatives a plus.
Expert SQL Proficiency: Mastery of SQL for querying and manipulating large datasets, coupled with familiarity with Salesforce, Marketo (or comparable marketing automation tools), and a BI tool (Tableau, Looker, Power BI, etc.) to create insightful reports and dashboards. Experience working with OLAP Databases (Snowflake, Amazon Redshift, Google BigQuery, ClickHouse, Databricks) a plus.
Python Experience: Experience with using or interest in learning to use Python or Jupyter Notebook/iPythonNotebook for simple analytics, financial modeling, data ETL, etc. a plus.
Data-Driven Problem Solver: Proven ability to translate complex business processes and data into actionable analytics solutions that address key business questions.
Strong Dimensional Modeling and Data Warehousing Knowledge: Deep understanding of dimensional modeling principles and data warehousing concepts to design and maintain efficient data structures.
Cross-Functional Collaboration Skills: Demonstrated ability to work effectively across teams, understanding the underlying needs behind data requests to deliver tailored analytics solutions.
Data Quality and Troubleshooting Expertise: Experience in identifying and resolving data discrepancies, working closely with Business Systems and Engineering teams to address upstream data issues and improve data integrity.
Curiosity and Analytical Mindset: A strong desire to understand complex systems and processes, with a knack for creating clarity and order from chaotic data environments.
Constructive Attitude Toward Improvement: A balanced approach to evaluation, with the ability to recognize what’s working well while identifying opportunities for enhancement.


Compensation/Location

Must be willing to be onsite in our SF office 2-3 days per week.

Salary Range: $133,000 - $184,000

Our compensation package includes equity and benefits in addition to salary.

Please note that the range listed is for someone based in the San Francisco Bay Area.

What We Offer

Our goal is to competitively and fairly compensate every Semgrep employee with a system that equally rewards those who are vocal and those who are less comfortable making demands during the final steps of the hiring process. To that end, we generate internal compensation bands that are used when discussing and negotiating salaries. We update these based on market data to make sure they’re above the average for comparable roles.

We also invest in our employees’ well-being and long term success with comprehensive health plans, generous vacation time, 401k, learning stipends, and more. Our benefits are for everyone, so that you’re taken care of, and we work with individuals to make sure they have what they need, whether that’s quiet work space, adjusted hours, or something else.

Who We Are

We have people from France and the Philippines, physics and philosophy, formal methods research and full fledged corporations. We’re new parents and new grads, aspiring authors and aspiring Americans, dog lovers and dogfooders. We get together often to bike, bake, and meet up in parks. In our interactions, we believe respect and honesty go hand in hand, and prioritize both.

Semgrep is an equal-opportunity employer seeking a diverse range of backgrounds. We value who you are — including your cultural heritage, your socioeconomic status, your age, your race, your gender, your sexual orientation, your disabilities. We value what’s vitally important to you — your family, your religion, your politics. We value what you love in this world — your music, your weekend pursuits. We believe in welcoming varied professional backgrounds, educations, and interests. If you’re exceptional in your role, believe in Semgrep’s mission, and treat Semgrep’s values as your own, you belong here.
Show more

Title: Operations Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Requisition ID # 163604

Job Category: Administrative / Clerical

Job Level: Individual Contributor

Business Unit: Electric Engineering

Work Type: Hybrid

Job Location: Oakland

Operations Data Analyst Intern

Department Overview

Electric T&D Engineering is responsible for the electric system engineering and planning, asset strategy, and risk management across transmission, distribution, and substation asset families. This centralized, risk-informed approach allows PG&E to manage electric risk, asset and system health, interconnections, and performance by using consistent standards, work methods, prioritization, and program sponsorship, while leveraging lessons learned from inspections and asset data to inform asset management decisions. Accountable for asset planning and strategy, standards and work methods, and asset data management for Electric.

Position Summary

PG&E is seeking a summer intern to be a member of the Electric Analysis and Intake (A&I) Team as a Operations Data Analyst.

The A&I team is responsible for the data intake, reporting, and tracking of:


Electric Incidents (EIRs) to the California Public Utilities Commission (CPUC)
Serious Injury or Fatalities (SIF)
Public Safety Incidents (PSI)
Other Apparent Cause and Root Cause Evaluations (ACE and RCE)


This role will focus primarily on the data intake, analysis, and elements associated with the Electric Compliance organization. A strong applicant will have a data analysis background and be comfortable working in Palantir/Foundry, PowerBI, Excel, Access, SQL and other databases (CAP, SAP). The role is classified as hybrid, working primarily from your remote office and in-person in the Oakland General Office, approximately once per week or more, as business needs require.

PG&E is providing the hourly rate range that the company in good faith believes it might pay for this position at the time of the job posting. This compensation range is specific to the locality of the job. The actual hourly rate paid to an individual will be based on multiple factors, including, but not limited to, specific skills, education, licenses or certifications, experience, market value, geographic location, and internal equity.

The hourly rate for a bachelor’s degree ranges from $19.91 to $35.37.

Responsibilities


Extract and analyze data from various PG&E systems, aggregating and synthesizing to formulate reports to support ongoing investigations.
Manage analysis projects in partnership with A&I Data Analyst.
Manage legacy data and transfer data to data aggregator tool, maintaining data integrity.
Data entry and clean up.


Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications:


Qualified candidates are pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering, Business, Computer Science or job related discipline at an accredited University
Students must be continuing their education towards their degree during and/or after the internship


Desired:


3.0 GPA or greater in both cumulative GPA and major GPA
Experience in Analysis/Trending/Metrics, Reporting/Governance, Project/Program Management, Engineering, Construction or working in an analytical/regulatory/legal environment and/or related education
Experience collecting and reviewing data (e.g., searching for anomalies/data gaps/inconsistencies), utilizing repeatable processes and adding controls when possible, to increase data integrity
Ability to work in a team environment and support fellow team members
Strong problem solving and analytical skills
Strong communication skills, both oral and written
Takes initiative and can work independently with minimal direction


PG&E is unable to provide VISA sponsorship to students on an F-1, J-1 or other student visa for this position.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst / Tableau Developer
Description:
Overview:

gRED Research Operations & Contracts (gROC) is a multi-disciplinary group at *** that focuses on removing barriers to enable pioneering science. Departments include Research Operations, Business & Resource Management, Training, and Contracts. The Business and Resource Management team supports gRED Research Biology and Drug Discovery leadership by ensuring that headcount resources are in alignment with the budget as well as portfolio tracking, and business process rollout as needed. Our data-driven approach enables leaders to have a comprehensive understanding of their current organization and where resources are deployed.

Your Role:

You will be joining the Research Business and Resource Management team to support a data visualization and metrics design initiative for gRED Research. This project will enable the business to become more data-driven and derive deeper insights from their data. The metrics hierarchy developed will serve as a foundation for future analytics projects throughout all departments. Organizational goals evolve over time, so you must be creative, adaptable, and willing to learn.

Responsibilities


Collaborate with gROC departments to develop and implement a robust data strategy and architecture
Partner with IT and other subject matter experts to develop foundational, robust, high quality, integrated data sets and metrics/KPIs to be used for visualization and advanced analytics
Bridge business needs with technical development by supporting the development of the metrics/KPI hierarchy throughout Research and compiling a data directory of various databases
Understand user requirements, underlying business processes, and source data to perform any required analysis and create powerful user-friendly reports
Build and improve automated and ad hoc data visualizations and dashboards (Tableau, ThoughtSpot, etc.) to enable businesses to use data to maximize their value
When relevant, collaborate with and/or lead a limited number of prioritized initiatives that align with and support Research's organizational goals


Qualifications

Preferred Majors: Business degree - Computer Science, Data Science, Analytics, Engineering, Statistics, Math or Operations Research

Skills:


Business acumen and ability to translate business needs into metrics
Experience with consulting diverse teams
Experience with data visualization (Tableau, ThoughtSpot etc.)
Experience with developing and defining metrics/KPIs
Experience with leveraging AI to identify actionable insights
Proficient with organizing data collected from various sources
Working knowledge with database, table design joins, data collection, data mining, data aggregation, data validation, data analytics etc.
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suites and/or Google Suites


Core Competencies:

Ability to work independently and proactively; Excellent written, presentation, and verbal communication skills; Eager to solve complex problems; Excellent organizational and interpersonal skills; Attention to detail, time management, self-motivated and has a positive attitude; Strong business focus and mentality; Flexibility and ability to interact well within both team-oriented and ambiguous settings
Show more

  • When relevant, collaborate with and/or lead a limited number of prioritized initiatives that align with and support Research's organizational goals

Qualifications

Preferred Majors: Business degree - Computer Science, Data Science, Analytics, Engineering, Statistics, Math or Operations Research

Skills:

  • Business acumen and ability to translate business needs into metrics
  • Experience with consulting diverse teams
  • Experience with data visualization (Tableau, ThoughtSpot etc.)
  • Experience with developing and defining metrics/KPIs
  • Experience with leveraging AI to identify actionable insights
  • Proficient with organizing data collected from various sources
  • Working knowledge with database, table design joins, data collection, data mining, data aggregation, data validation, data analytics etc.
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office Suites and/or Google Suites

Core Competencies:

Ability to work independently and proactively; Excellent written, presentation, and verbal communication skills; Eager to solve complex problems; Excellent organizational and interpersonal skills; Attention to detail, time management, self-motivated and has a positive attitude; Strong business focus and mentality; Flexibility and ability to interact well within both team-oriented and ambiguous settings

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst




Location: Hybrid onsite schedule in Culver City or Cupertino, CA

Duration: 12 months; potential to extend

Pay: up to $65.90/hour, DOE (W2 and option for benefits)




Planet Interactive is looking for a Data Analyst to join our well-known Fortune 500 client on a 12 month contract. This role will be 40 hours per week and is hybrid in Culver City or Cupertino, CA.




The Data Analyst will support the development and implementation of internal data tools, dashboards, and reports. The person is responsible for analyzing large data sets, creating data visualizations, and providing strategic insights. This role requires an extremely detail-oriented, strategic, and driven person who is familiar with data tools and applications. The ideal candidate will be a problem-solver with a passion for learning new tools, tools implementation, and ability to work cross-functionally. They will need to have clear and effective communication skills and be able to work well with various teams. They should be curious about learning how user groups operate, but also have a long-tail desire to help an organization optimize the way it works overall.




Responsibilities:

Develop tools and provide analysis to support data driven decision making
Collect feedback from users to create automated reporting and compelling data visualization solutions with minimal supervision
Build and scale maintainable data infrastructures and end to end reporting solutions that connect business and finance teams with critical data
Monitor and maintain data pipelines and preemptively solve and raise issues
Identify trends and patterns in financial data that contribute to diagnostic and predictive analytics efforts, along with data reporting & presentation
Data entry and optimization as needed




Qualifications:

5+ years experience in a tools, platforms, or applications implementation role
5+ years of experience implementing business processes in software tools
5+ years of experience implementing data pipelines and flows
Expertise in SQL, Python, Data lake systems such as Snowflake, and Tableau
Experience with ETL/Reverse ETL processes and data cleanup preferred
Experience working with central data and analytics teams
Expert knowledge of data management, metric building, and tools
Experience testing and implementing workflow management systems or software
Experience handling sensitive and classified information/data with the utmost discretion
Knowledge of Financial Data such as Purchase Requests, Purchase Orders, and Invoices preferred

Title: Data Analyst with Healthcare experience - Remote
Description:
Position Responsibilities


Ingest, standardize, and analyze pharmacy and medical claims and eligibility files
Use exploratory data analysis (EDA) to identify general patterns and outlier data points
Build new and optimize existing ETL processes
Engage cross-functionality to identify, prioritize and deliver data and analysis requirements
Partner with stakeholders to ensure data accuracy, consistency, and reliability; prioritize and deliver actionable insights from analytics
Facilitate a data-driven approach to problem solving by increasing data accessibility across the organization via automated reports and dashboards
Develop, maintain and QA an automated process to pull data and populate templates for monthly, quarterly, annual reports, including ad hoc client, sales and investor reports
Present financial reports to clients and prospects
Build and track effectiveness of rules identified by clinicians to generate engagement opportunities to improve member outcomes and drive savings
Collaborate with Product, Engineering and marketing to monitor engagement performance, identify new product features, and measure impact
Partner with external data vendors to securely transfer health data ensuring efficient and correct processing at scale.



Requirements

Qualifications and Skills


BS in STEM or other quantitative subject (e.g. economics, finance); MS degree a plus
3 years of professional experience analyzing data, generating dashboards and reports, and providing insights derived from research to cross-functional teams
2 years of experience working with healthcare data
Understands and supports business priorities
Experience working with large, complex healthcare datasets
Proficiency with SQL
Understanding of applied statistics
Ability to distill and communicate analytic results to variety of stakeholders
Strong problem-solving and communication skills
Ability to accurately articulate a technically complex subject matter to an audience spanning the technical competency spectrum
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, and to work independently
Careful attention to detail, accuracy and deadlines with the ability to multitask on different projects


Preferred Qualifications:


Experience creating clear deliverables from vague requirements
Experience with Python and Pandas
Experience developing advanced models (i.e. machine learning, linear regression)
Familiarity with working with big data and no-sql databases
Familiarity with AWS and data visualization platforms like Looker,Tableau, or Sigma Computing
Self-motivated, creative, curious, attention to detail
Familiarity with working with source control system, e.g. Github and Github Actions
Experience with presenting reports to clients and senior management
Ability to create and maintain standard operating procedures for all data activities
Experience with Artificial Intelligence



Benefits

Benefits


Remote position
Unlimited time off
Health insurance
Excellent company culture

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
This position will require you to be in Cleveland, OH

We are in a hybrid schedule, 2 days on campus and 3 days WFH




The Data Analyst's responsibilities include performing complex analysis in an evolving data environment, defining data architecture needs, creating use cases for data technologies and advancing our collective awareness of and expertise in data analytics and intelligence. This position will interact with new and existing data to improve data usability and quality, find trends, identify insights and provide thought leadership on how to derive value from those aspects of data.




Responsibilities:

Work closely with the marketing team to analyze the effectiveness of marketing campaigns, providing insights into key marketing performance indicators (KPIs) such as ROI, ROAS, and customer lifetime value (CLV).
Collaborate with marketing leadership to develop and implement a Marketing Measurement Framework, evaluating the impact of campaigns and optimizing marketing spend.
Coordinate projects, data and operational needs with colleagues to support team objectives.
Map and trace data from system to system to solve a given business or system problem. Document the types and structure of the business data (logical modeling).
Perform audits on data and resolve data quality issues.
Analyze and evaluate incoming data from many disparate data sources to inform data modeling and design decisions for large data integration projects.
Apply data analysis or data modeling techniques to establish, modify or maintain complex data structures and their associated components to increase efficiency of structures and components.
Question, define and coordinate analytic needs with project managers, product owners, marketing specialists and other stake holders to prepare requirements and schedule deliverables.
Write, audit and execute basic to complex levels of SQL or R code.
Perform statistical, modeling and data analyses of business data; interpret those data and analyses; and prepare insights for presentation.
Build predictive, quantitative and other statistical models necessary to meet business objectives and execution-based strategies.
Design and create data reports and reporting tools to help partners across the enterprise in their decision making.
Utilize tools such as Tableau, SSRS and R to develop and communicate data reports, insights and visualizations.
Act as internal consultant to business units and product owners to provide assistance in the development of analytical models and unit-based decision support systems (e.g., workload, projection vs. goal, etc.).
Offer advice in determining the appropriate analytical methodology to meet the needs and achieve overall company objectives.




Requirements:

Bachelor’s Degree in related field (Data Analysis, Statistics, Quantitative Analysis or Statistical Modeling, etc.).
3 -7 years of experience in data analysis.
Previous experience in marketing analytics, with a strong understanding of how to measure and evaluate the success of marketing campaigns.
Proven experience in calculating and analyzing Return on Investment (ROI) for marketing initiatives to drive data-informed decision-making.
Strong knowledge of data administration, repository management, database creation techniques, data warehousing standards, strategies, and tools.
Proficient with database and statistical software and product configurations.
Strong understanding of and ability to write successful code within applications in use at OverDrive including SQL, SSRS, Tableau, R and others.
Ability to interpret data linkages, hierarchies, sequencing and nuances in new data sources.
Ability to communicate strategies and processes around data modeling and architecture to cross functional groups and senior levels.
Ability to resolve problems, conduct thorough research and develop alternatives and solutions.
Strong documentation and communication skills.
Exceptional time management skills.
Strong attention to detail with excellent organizational skills.
Ability to work and thrive in a fast-paced, rapidly-changing environment.
Capable of working cooperatively with internal and external customers, as well as being an enthusiastic team player.




What’s Next:




As you’ve probably guessed, OverDrive is a place that values individuality and variety. We don’t want you to be like everyone else, we don’t even want you to be like us—we want you to be like you! So, if you're interested in joining the OverDrive team, apply below and tell us what inspires you about OverDrive and why you think you are perfect for our team.




OverDrive values diversity and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

What we do at Shaker matters. We help to connect people with jobs. A recruitment marketing pioneer since 1951, Shaker is a full-service agency specializing in highly customized communications and strategies for attracting and retaining the right talent...in the right places, with the right messages. That takes smarts and creativity. Ideas and innovation. That takes great people of many talents. And that is exactly what we have at Shaker. There’s so much we can accomplish together.Join us.

Job Description

As a Data Analyst at Shaker, you’ll help build and maintain our reporting infrastructure and ensure our internal teams and clients have access to the data they need to optimize the performance of media investments and manage them for maximum cost-effectiveness. From partnering with Ad-ops to ensure we are capturing actionable data, to ensuring data is accurately flowing into our data warehouse and finally working alongside our Data Strategists ensuring that our dashboards are up to date and making our data accessible, you will have an opportunity to work on every aspect of the business.

Responsibilities


Work closely with multiple teams to ensure our data is accurate, accessible, and actionable.
Collaborate with media teams to monitor and maintain dashboards and data visualizations.
Build and maintain dashboards in Tableau.
Create/contribute to PowerPoint presentations.
Partner with Client, Media, and Ad Ops to ensure accurate data collection.


Qualifications


1+ years of related experience
Comfortable working with data in tools like Excel, Python and R
Proficiency with Tableau or other BI tools
Ability to collect, analyze, and present data.
Experience making data accessible through visualizations.
Ability to collect, pull insights from, and present data.
Familiarity with the digital media industry (esp. recruitment marketing) is a plus.
Value respect, inclusion, and teamwork.
Self-starter with a focus on team success.
Ability to constructively accept and positively provide feedback.
Exceptional attention to detail and follow-through.
Strength in prioritizing workload; meeting or exceeding deadlines


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Additional Information

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Stripe

Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.

About The Team

Data Science at Stripe is a vibrant community where data analysts, data scientists and engineers learn and grow together. You will work with some of Stripe’s most fundamental and exciting data, and use that data to help drive company-wide initiatives. We have a variety of Data Analytics roles and teams across Stripe and will seek to align you to the most relevant team based on your background.

What you'll do

In this role, you will partner deeply with teams across Stripe to ensure that our users, our products, and our business have the models, data products, and insights needed to make decisions and grow responsibly. You will work closely with partners to extract insights from Stripe's rich and complex data. You will also work with leaders to translate business needs into data problems. You will build metrics, scalable data pipelines, dashboards, and reports to inform and run the business. You will deliver actionable business recommendations through analyses and data storytelling.

Who you are

We’re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.

Minimum Requirements


2-8+ years experience in Business Intelligence Engineering, Data Engineering, Data Analysis or Data Science roles, building data pipelines and analyzing large datasets to solve problems
Proficiency in SQL and Python
Strong statistical knowledge
Expertise in visualization and using data insights to make recommendations and achieve goals
Proven ability to manage and deliver on multiple projects with great attention to detail
Ability to clearly communicate results and drive impact
Comfortable collaborating across functions to identify data analytics problems and execute solutions with technical rigor and data-driven insights.



Preferred Qualifications


Master’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, or a related technical field.
Prior experience at a growth stage internet or software company.
Experience with distributed data frameworks like Hadoop and Spark to write and debug data pipelines.
Good understanding of development processes and best practices like engineering standards, code reviews, and testing.



Hybrid work at Stripe

This role is available either in an office or a remote location (typically, 35+ miles or 56+ km from a Stripe office).

Office-assigned Stripes spend at least 50% of the time in a given month in their local office or with users. This hits a balance between bringing people together for in-person collaboration and learning from each other, while supporting flexibility about how to do this in a way that makes sense for individuals and their teams.

A remote location, in most cases, is defined as being 35 miles (56 kilometers) or more from one of our offices. While you would be welcome to come into the office for team/business meetings, on-sites, meet-ups, and events, our expectation is you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location where you currently or plan to live.

Pay and benefits

The annual US base salary range for this role is $146,900 - $220,300. For sales roles, the range provided is the role’s On Target Earnings ("OTE") range, meaning that the range includes both the sales commissions/sales bonuses target and annual base salary for the role. This salary range may be inclusive of several career levels at Stripe and will be narrowed during the interview process based on a number of factors, including the candidate’s experience, qualifications, and location. Applicants interested in this role and who are not located in the US may request the annual salary range for their location during the interview process.

Additional benefits for this role may include: equity, company bonus or sales commissions/bonuses; 401(k) plan; medical, dental, and vision benefits; and wellness stipends.

  • Experience with distributed data frameworks like Hadoop and Spark to write and debug data pipelines.
