  • 20% Leverages data analytics tools to create new dashboards, reports, and any additional ad-hoc requests
  • 20% Ensures the quality of work output by displaying a keen attention to detail
  • 20% Develops additional technical competencies and subject matter expertise within core functional group
  • 10% Presents findings in easily understood ways, focuses on how the data analytics fits into the bigger picture

Direct Manager/Direct Reports

  • This postion reports to Manager
  • This position has no Direct Reports

Travel Requirements

  • Typically requires overnight travel less than 10% of the time.

Physical Requirements

  • Most of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position and there is frequent opportunity to move about. On rare occasions there may be a need to move or lift light articles.

Working Conditions

  • Located in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Must be eighteen years of age or older.
  • Must be legally permitted to work in the United States.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Work experience with SQL Server, Teradata, Oracle, or comparable database systems
  • 1-3 years work experience in data mining, statistical analysis, auditing, and/or forecasting.
  • Prior direct experience in analyzing the relevant subject matter (e.g. Supply Chain, Merchandising, Operations, etc.)
  • B.S. in Computer Science, Math, Engineering, Finance or related quantitative field

Minimum Education

  • The knowledge, skills and abilities typically acquired through the completion of a bachelor's degree program or equivalent degree in a field of study related to the job.

Preferred Education

  • No additional education

Minimum Years Of Work Experience

  • 0

Preferred Years Of Work Experience

  • No additional years of experience

Minimum Leadership Experience

  • None

Preferred Leadership Experience

  • None

Certifications

  • None

Competencies

  • Critical thinking skills to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions; ability to understand and foresee implications of new information for current and future problems solving.
  • An unquenchable intellectual curiosity for getting at the underlying story being told within the data.
  • Strong written and verbal communications skills. Ability to persuade, inform, and influence others based on findings. A track record of taking complex results and communicating them in an easily understood way.
  • Superior interpersonal skills and ability to collaborate actively and work in a team environment.
  • Ability to quickly learn and adapt to new technologies, tools, and techniques.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About the Company:

Octave is a modern behavioral health practice creating a new standard for care delivery that’s both high-quality and accessible. With in-person and virtual clinics in multiple states, the company offers evidence-based individual, couples, and family therapy, while pioneering relationships with payers to make care more affordable through insurance. By raising the bar on how care is delivered and how providers are supported, we are building a sustainable system that values equity, affordability, and effectiveness.

Job Summary:

Octave is looking for an experienced Senior Data Analyst to join our growing data team. We are looking for an individual to help lay the foundation of analytics and data science at the company with a specific focus on growth and marketing initiatives. The role will help establish operating KPIs and identify opportunities to continue to accelerate the growth of the business. There will be a strong focus on developing engaging data visualizations via dashboards to deliver data driven insights for our business stakeholders. In addition, we will be looking for an individual who can help establish processes and identify opportunities to optimize and scale existing workflows.

We are a full-stack behavioral health services company: we employ therapists, contract with insurance providers for reimbursing care, and run our own tech stack to support across the business. We are a technology-enabled service provider working to increase access to mental health care for insured people in the US. Automation and strong systems are the lynchpin for enabling scale and driving access for more people to get care.

Responsibilities Include:


Partner closely with cross-functional teams, including product managers, analysts, engineers, and business stakeholders, to identify key business problems and develop analytic solutions that drive growth and innovation.
Communicate sophisticated analyses and results to a wide array of business partners with varying levels of technical expertise.
Create and maintain operational dashboards in Tableau to understand company performance over time and enable partners with self-serve tools.
Develop efficient and scalable end to end workflows and identify opportunities to improve existing processes.
Translating business operations and processes into scalable data and reporting.



Preferred Requirements:


4+ years working in analytics/data science preferably with experience at a startup.
4+ years hands on technical analysis work with SQL experience performing complex data transformations. Experience manipulating large data sets and uncovering insights utilizing disparate data sources and tools.
Deep understanding of marketing analytics, including multi-touch attribution models (e.g., first-touch, last-touch, time-decay), media mix modeling, and ROI measurement across channels.
Proven experience using tools like Mixpanel, Google Analytics 4 (GA4), and Tableau to track and analyze marketing performance.
Experience with marketing funnel analysis, including diagnosing drop-offs, conversion bottlenecks, and optimization strategies to improve efficiency.
Track record of improving marketing KPIs, such as CAC, LTV, ROAS, and overall funnel conversion rates through data-driven insights.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to apply business strategy to data analysis and recommendations.
Expert in data visualization (Tableau/Looker/etc).
Strong communication skills. Ability to tell story with data and explain the nuance to stakeholders.
Ability to think strategically (interfacing with senior leaders), while also enjoying being hands-on with the data.
A knack for asking the right questions, then answering them with sound data and analysis.
Experience with dbt/git/aws is a plus.



Octave's Company Values:

The below values drive our day-to-day operations.


We’re human beings first. We operate with empathy and kindness – with our clients, with our collaborators, and with ourselves.
People deserve better than status quo. We’re willing to tackle the intractable problems, no matter how big, because someone should. We ask big questions, we craft big solutions, and we challenge ourselves and others to make it happen.
No bystanders. No stars. No tourists. Each person has been selected to be here, and with that comes a responsibility to bring your expertise, share your ideas, and help make this company better.
Partnership paves the path ahead. We don’t operate in a silo, internally or externally. To transform the system, we believe in working with others to create something bigger, better, and stronger.
Quality is crucial at scale. Quality is core to our business, and we refuse to sacrifice it as we grow.
Progress is a process. In the pursuit of progress, we iterate, reflect, learn, adjust – and always leave things better than we found them.
There are people behind every data point. We recognize that numbers tell only one part of the story, and we also do the work to understand impacts at the individual level



Physical Requirements:


Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
Must be able to frequently communicate with others through virtual meeting applications such as Zoom and Google Meet.
Must be able to observe and communicate information on company provided laptop.
Move up to 10 pounds on occasion.
Must be eligible to work in the United States without sponsorship now or in the future.



Compensation:

Octave is committed to pay equity. To maintain our commitment to pay equity, Octave will follow Pay Transparency regulations on all open job postings. Current Pay Transparency laws require companies to include a position's salary or hourly wage range (not including bonuses or equity-based compensation) in any internal or external job posting. This requirement extends to job postings published by a third party at an employer's request.

Octave will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with Octave’s legal duty to furnish information.

Starting pay for qualified applicants will depend on a combination of job-related factors, which may include education, training, experience, location, business needs, or market demands. The expected salary range for this role is set forth below and this range may be modified in the future.

The salary range is for zone 1 (all states not in zone 2 or zone 3) $132,100 - $142,600.

The salary range for zone 2 (CO, HI, MD, RI) is $145,300 - $156,900.

The salary range for zone 3 (AK, CA, CT, MA, NJ, NY, WA) is $152,000 - $164,000.

All zones are eligible for equity in the form of stock options.

Additionally, this position is eligible for the following benefits: company sponsored life insurance, disability and AD&D plans. Voluntary benefits such as 401k retirement, medical, dental, vision, FSA, HSA, dependent care and commuter/parking options are also available. Octave offers generous Paid Time Off as well as paid parental leave benefits.

This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Application Instructions:

Please complete the following application. Please note that the U.S. Equal Opportunity Employment Information questions below are used for the purposes of EEOC reporting and are optional to complete. Octave is unable to change these questions and we acknowledge that many of the U.S. Equal Opportunity Employment Information questions are not inclusive or affirming of all aspects of cultural identity. Octave is committed to an inclusive workplace environment, and this information will not inform how we approach hiring or employment.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst II
Description:
About Pinterest

Millions of people across the world come to Pinterest to find new ideas every day. It’s where they get inspiration, dream about new possibilities and plan for what matters most. Our mission is to help those people find their inspiration and create a life they love. In your role, you’ll be challenged to take on work that upholds this mission and pushes Pinterest forward. You’ll grow as a person and leader in your field, all the while helping Pinners make their lives better in the positive corner of the internet.

Creating a life you love also means finding a career that celebrates the unique perspectives and experiences that you bring. As you read through the expectations of the position, consider how your skills and experiences may complement the responsibilities of the role. We encourage you to think through your relevant and transferable skills from prior experiences.

Our new progressive work model is called PinFlex, a term that’s uniquely Pinterest to describe our flexible approach to living and working. Visit our PinFlex landing page to learn more.

The Sales Strategy & Operations (SS&O) team partners with advertising sales leaders across sales strategy and analytics, operations and process and tools. Team members are experts in business strategy and operations and analytical and strategic thinking. They are pragmatic and results-oriented. As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will focus on empowering sales leadership and the broader sales organization with self-serve access to data and insights. You’ll be responsible for designing, building and maintaining scaled sales analytics solutions (dashboards, data tables) for over one thousand internal users.

What You’ll Do


Collaborate with SS&O team members and sales leaders to define key business metrics and gather requirements for which insights should be made available at scale. Architect data pipelines, design and build new Tableau dashboards for stakeholders to use to address their needs. Maintain and improve existing sales data infrastructure and Tableau dashboards based on evolving business requirements.
Democratize sales data by enabling self-serve access to key business drivers, trends and operating metrics. Design fully automated dashboards that are easy to understand, enable self-serve access for the sales org, and can be used by a broad audience with a variety of use cases.
Publish and maintain clear documentation to inform and educate users at scale, gather feedback to identify opportunities for improvement.
Identify ways to streamline and improve the efficiency of our data. Implement changes to our infrastructure (optimize SQL queries and data workflows) to improve the landing time of our data.
Work with cross-functional teams including Sales, Strategic Finance, and Business Intelligence to identify data needs and gaps, and align on solutions.
Lead projects end to end, see around corners and provide thought partnership to your team.



What We’re Looking For


3+ years of professional experience in highly analytical environments such as management consulting, investment banking, corporate strategy or technology/media companies.
Understanding of sales and digital advertising platforms and working knowledge of sales systems and tools (Salesforce).
Strong data analytics and business intelligence skills - querying large data sets with advanced SQL, building visualizations with Tableau. Experience building and maintaining data pipelines (authoring, scheduling, monitoring workflows).
Ability to visualize complex data sets that provide insights and clearly inform areas of action.
Passion for building new solutions and enabling analysis at scale to drive decision-making.
Experience in a complex, fast-paced environment.
Organized, detail-oriented and strategically focused.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as business administration, or equivalent experience.



Relocation Statement:


This position is not eligible for relocation assistance. Visit our PinFlex page to learn more about our working model.



In-Office Requirement Statement


We let the type of work you do guide the collaboration style. That means we're not always working in an office, but we continue to gather for key moments of collaboration and connection.
This role will need to be in the office for in-person collaboration 1-2 times/month and therefore needs to be in a commutable distance from the NY office.



At Pinterest we believe the workplace should be equitable, inclusive, and inspiring for every employee. In an effort to provide greater transparency, we are sharing the base salary range for this position. The position is also eligible for equity. Final salary is based on a number of factors including location, travel, relevant prior experience, or particular skills and expertise.

Information regarding the culture at Pinterest and benefits available for this position can be found here.

US based applicants only

$80,710—$166,168 USD

Our Commitment To Diversity

Pinterest is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit. We want to have the best qualified people in every job. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion or religious creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, status as a protected veteran, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information or characteristics (or those of a family member) or any other consideration made unlawful by applicable federal, state or local laws. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you require a medical or religious accommodation during the job application process, please complete this form for support.

We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Education

Hybrid- NYC

Compensation: $85,000-$105,000




About the Organization

Join a nationally recognized, high-performing educational organization dedicated to transforming K-12 public education. Known for its innovative, whole-child approach and exceptional academic outcomes, this organization empowers students from diverse backgrounds with the skills, knowledge, and confidence to thrive in college and beyond. As they continue to scale, they’re seeking a Data Analyst to help drive data-driven decision-making and innovation.







Role Overview

As a Data Analyst, you’ll play a key role in democratizing data and advancing analytics across the organization. Reporting to the Head of Analytics, you will develop dashboards, uncover insights through SQL queries, and build data models in dbt—all in support of improving student outcomes. This is an opportunity to make a meaningful impact in education through data and technology.







Key Responsibilities

Query an AWS data warehouse using SQL to extract insights that drive strategic decisions.
Build and maintain SQL transformations in dbt to support reporting and analytics needs.
Collaborate with data engineers to refine datasets and optimize data pipelines.
Develop and manage dashboards in Looker, providing key insights for leadership and operational teams.
Work closely with school operations and management to translate business needs into effective data solutions.




Required Skills & Experience

Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, or a related technical field—or equivalent experience in data analytics.
2+ years of experience writing complex SQL queries.
Proficiency with data visualization tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau, Power BI).
Strong communication skills with the ability to present complex data in a clear and accessible way.
Proven ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment.
Experience with dbt SQL coding and/or LookML is a plus.







How to Apply

Interested? Submit your resume to Gabriella Ferrara via the Apply link on this page.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Ascendion




Ascendion is a full-service digital engineering solutions company. We make and manage software platforms and products that power growth and deliver captivating experiences to consumers and employees. Our engineering, cloud, data, experience design, and talent solution capabilities accelerate transformation and impact for enterprise clients. Headquartered in New Jersey, our workforce of 6,000+ Ascenders delivers solutions from around the globe. Ascendion is built differently to engineer the next.




Ascendion | Engineering to elevate life




We have a culture built on opportunity, inclusion, and a spirit of partnership. Come, change the world with us:




Build the coolest tech for world’s leading brands

Solve complex problems - and learn new skills

Experience the power of transforming digital engineering for Fortune 500 clients

Master your craft with leading training programs and hands-on experience

Experience a community of change makers!




Join a culture of high-performing innovators with endless ideas and a passion for tech. Our culture is the fabric of our company, and it is what makes us unique and diverse. The way we share ideas, learning, experiences, successes, and joy allows everyone to be their best at Ascendion.




About the Role:

Job Title:

Data Analyst




Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with data engineers, product owners, and data analysts to understand source and target data models and establish mappings.
Perform thorough analysis of diverse healthcare datasets, including patients, providers, claims, insurance enrollment, risk adjustment, quality measures, and operational data.
Document mapping specifications for each field, considering data accuracy and completeness.
Define and refine transformation logic to reconcile differences between external and internal data structures.




Minimum Qualifications:

8+ Years of experience in IT.
Healthcare Data Expertise: Knowledge of healthcare terminology and coding systems (e.g., ICD, CPT, HCPCS) and experience working with healthcare data sets spanning everything from medical claims, prescription claims, provider/facility records, eligibility/enrollment data, and more.
Data Mapping: Strong understanding of data normalization, ETL processes, and schema mapping between disparate data sources.
Technical Proficiency: Proficiency in SQL and Excel.
Attention to Detail: High standard of accuracy in documenting mappings and attention to nuanced differences between data sources.




Desired Qualifications:

Medicare, Medicaid experience




Location:

Dallas, TX, or 100% Remote




Salary Range: The salary for this position is between $80,000- $90,000 annually. Factors which may affect pay within this range may include geography/market, skills, education, experience, and other qualifications of the successful candidate.

About Ascendion


Ascendion is a full-service digital engineering solutions company. We make and manage software platforms and products that power growth and deliver captivating experiences to consumers and employees. Our engineering, cloud, data, experience design, and talent solution capabilities accelerate transformation and impact for enterprise clients. Headquartered in New Jersey, our workforce of 6,000+ Ascenders delivers solutions from around the globe. Ascendion is built differently to engineer the next.


Ascendion | Engineering to elevate life


We have a culture built on opportunity, inclusion, and a spirit of partnership. Come, change the world with us:


Build the coolest tech for world’s leading brands

Solve complex problems - and learn new skills

Experience the power of transforming digital engineering for Fortune 500 clients

Master your craft with leading training programs and hands-on experience

Experience a community of change makers!


Join a culture of high-performing innovators with endless ideas and a passion for tech. Our culture is the fabric of our company, and it is what makes us unique and diverse. The way we share ideas, learning, experiences, successes, and joy allows everyone to be their best at Ascendion.


About the Role:

Job Title:

  • Data Analyst


Key Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with data engineers, product owners, and data analysts to understand source and target data models and establish mappings.
  • Perform thorough analysis of diverse healthcare datasets, including patients, providers, claims, insurance enrollment, risk adjustment, quality measures, and operational data.
  • Document mapping specifications for each field, considering data accuracy and completeness.
  • Define and refine transformation logic to reconcile differences between external and internal data structures.


Minimum Qualifications:

  • 8+ Years of experience in IT.
  • Healthcare Data Expertise: Knowledge of healthcare terminology and coding systems (e.g., ICD, CPT, HCPCS) and experience working with healthcare data sets spanning everything from medical claims, prescription claims, provider/facility records, eligibility/enrollment data, and more.
  • Data Mapping: Strong understanding of data normalization, ETL processes, and schema mapping between disparate data sources.
  • Technical Proficiency: Proficiency in SQL and Excel.
  • Attention to Detail: High standard of accuracy in documenting mappings and attention to nuanced differences between data sources.


Desired Qualifications:

  • Medicare, Medicaid experience


Location:

  • Dallas, TX, or 100% Remote


Salary Range: The salary for this position is between $80,000- $90,000 annually. Factors which may affect pay within this range may include geography/market, skills, education, experience, and other qualifications of the successful candidate.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position: Data Analyst

Location: Hybrid in Quincy, MA

Duration: 4+ month contract with possibility of extensions




Our client is executing a large-scale data modernization across its agency. This includes creating a consolidated Enterprise Data Platform on modern cloud tools (including AWS & Snowflake,) and re-platforming existing business data applications from solutions such as SAS and legacy databases to the new platform. The data systems enable epidemiologists, public health researchers, state and local public health officials, and business leaders to analyze public health trends and drive policy decisions.




The Data Analyst will support this group in its efforts to implement a new central Data modernization program. The Data Analyst will provide input on best practices and potential efficiencies, work on multiple assignments concurrently to meet aggressive due dates. The Data Analyst will use a range of expert technical skills based on a keen knowledge of data and analytic concepts, and must be proficient with SQL, Python, R, Snowflake, SharePoint, Tableau and/or other Business Intelligence & Programming Tools. This resource needs to have hands on experience analyzing and interpreting complex data needs to develop solutions that improve decision making and operational efficiency. This resource will also be responsible for providing subject matter expertise in the development of requirements as agencies transition to the data modernization program.




In the initial stages of the engagement, the Analyst will be expected to work with data from multiple disparate sources to meet reporting goals. This will be data of varying completeness and quality from systems such as EHRs, enrollment platforms, and operations applications. As the Enterprise Data Platform matures and more data is integrated and improved, the Analyst will use their schools to generate data sets and analysis based on objects in Snowflake. The ideal candidate is comfortable in a maturing landscape and is able to use their data skills and business understanding to answer questions with imperfect systems.




JOB DUTIES:

Develop reports and data visualizations using Tableau Server
Provide ad-hoc reports and extract based on user requests
Provide gap analysis of current data extract process
Identify remediation of data pipeline process gaps and propose solutions
Validate results of all extracts and reports
Interact on a professional basis with internal and external staff in a personable manner
Develop reports as requested
Support on-going development of Key Performance Indicator Collection Tools and Reports
Communicate business requirements to developers and work with them to implement solutions for the business community where appropriate.
Communicate progress, or impediments to progress, to users and managers.
Organize and maintain workload and work independently with limited supervision
Participate in, and contribute to, team projects and meetings




SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS (Special Skill Set, Abilities & Knowledge):

Mange assigned requests from a variety of diverse business users
Understand business requirements, regulatory needs and their impact on business as well as well as the technology essential to support them
Maintain comprehensive code and documentation consistent with best practices and agency policy
Generate accurate deliverables consistently and under pressure
Evaluation requests, gather business requirements and creatively develop solutions, generating accurate deliverables consistently and under pressure
Improve and innovate processes and programs that meeting user needs
Produce standard and ad hoc reports using various tools and data sources
Conduct advanced data mining in a timely and accurate manner as required
Produce business and system documentation based on clients standards




EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE: (Education, Year' Experience & Certificates):

BS in Computer Science, related degree, or equivalent experience
Experience working with SQL, Python, R, Snowflake, SharePoint, Tableau and/or other Business Intelligence & Programming Tools required
3+ years' experience working as a programmer/developer, preferably in healthcare

Title: Junior Data Analyst (H/F)
Description:
EY is currently looking for a Data Analyst with Python knowledge and with a good French level - Junior to join our Tax Technology practice.

Key Responsibilities


Assist with importing, cleansing, and correcting accounting data to prepare it for analysis using Python/Pandas/Excel
Ability in interpreting accounting data and analyzing results using different techniques
Experience in data models and data sets, variety of data sources and data cleaning methods
Perform reconciliations of tax and accounting data to financial statements and other accounting records
Create reports and presentations to help communicate data findings to team members
Participate in team meeting and drafting meeting notes
Develop a strong understanding of business requirements; working with business users/ business analysts to define probable solutions.


Qualification & Experience Required

Bachelors / master’s degree in accounting / information Technology / business analytics or related field.

Basic knowledge of accounting principles and practices is a must.

No less than 1 year of hands-on experience with data manipulation (Analysis) using Python/Pandas

Must have knowledge in relational databases, Hands on experience in SQL Queries

Strong verbal and written communications skills in French and English.

Mastery of Pack Office

In the context of its Diversity policy, EY considers, on an equal skills basis, all applications, including those from individuals with disabilities. EY offers a multitude of experiences to live, numerous sectors to explore, and extraordinary encounters.

Join us in building a better working world.

Live the EY experience, join us!

Title: Junior Data Analyst (SQL)
Description:
We offer:




• Become a member of a dynamic team which support Wealth Managements strategic objectives through the use and exploitation of its data and analytical assets

• International/multinational environment: team in Budapest Office works closely with the New York office.

• Collaborative creative environment

• Contingent/Leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley

• Contract via 3rd party agency




You will:




• Partner extensively with other teams and business partners within and outside the department (such as sales, marketing, product owners, data science and data visualization teams) to deliver business solutions and support decision making

• Liaise with Technology partners to understand the data source and suggest enhancements as needed

• Utilize proactive problem-solving and innovative thinking to address challenges

• Build, monitor and review data models and conduct analyses based on specific requirements

• Provide analytics and insight for various business initiatives and projects

• Prepare and deliver presentations to highlight important metrics and showcase achievements

• Create relevant documentation where needed

• Assist in the development of Tableau dashboards and data visualizations for reporting to senior management and business users including Financial Advisors




You have:




• 0-3 years data analytics experience

• Bachelor’s or higher degree in Business Management or Economics or IT or Data Science

• Tech skills: SQL/Python/R

• Strong analytical mindset

• Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills

• Detail oriented and ability to handle, prioritize multiple tasks simultaneously

• Passion for providing help to navigate through complex decisions for clients

• Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills

• Great presentation skills




You might also have:




• Background in the Financial Services Industry, with an emphasis on wealth management

• Experience working with technology teams closely

• Experience in data modelling and visualization technologies, such as: Dataiku, Python, Tableau, PowerBI, QlikView




Team Profile:




The Analytics & Data (A&D) organization is a key growth area within Morgan Stanley’s Wealth Management Division, playing a critical role in the execution of the wider Wealth Management strategy. The use of analytics and data will be a key driver in accelerating growth across all client segments, enabling data-driven decision making and delivering the best client experience.




About us:




Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services.

At Morgan Stanley Budapest, we are shaping the future of our global business and contributing to our local community. Our team works across numerous areas, including Technology, Mathematical Modelling, Finance, Risk Management, Wealth Management, and Data & Analytics from our state-of-the-art offices near the Danube and our City Gate office in the heart of the City Centre.

Title: Data Analyst - AdTech
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst - AdTech Targeting Platform:




€60K + 30% bonus + stocks




About Our Client:

We're partnering with a leading global company revolutionizing the digital advertising landscape. They offer a cutting-edge, privacy-first unified targeting platform that empowers marketers to reach their ideal audiences with unparalleled precision. Trusted by Fortune 500 companies and emerging brands alike, their solutions drive increased reach, boost efficiency, and maximize ROI. With a global presence spanning the US, EMEA and Nordics they foster a tight-knit, collaborative culture that values diversity, innovation, and a passion for making a real impact.




About the Role:

As a Data Analyst - Solutions, you will play a crucial role in the successful implementation, optimization, and support of our client's ad tech solutions for clients across EMEA, APAC, and NAM regions. This position requires a strong understanding of advertising technology, exceptional data analytics skills, and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.




Day-to-Day Responsibilities:

Develop and optimize accurate, scalable taxonomies for Always-On offerings across markets, focusing on performance and reach.
Serve as the primary technical support contact for clients, including media agencies, trading desks, publishers, and advertisers. Build strong client relationships and provide training on the platform.
Collaborate with partners to maintain and enhance taxonomies. Optimize internal SaaS platforms and advise on external platforms like DSPs and SSPs.
Act as a liaison between Data and Marketing teams to promote best-in-class segments and support seasonal and Always-On targets.
Conduct market analysis and competitive assessments, ensuring CPM competitiveness and proposing new strategies.
Maintain technical stability, troubleshoot issues, and develop custom solutions for partners.
Ensure data discoverability, understand data interactions with partner algorithms, and recommend tailored solutions for campaign optimization.
Collaborate on reporting and analysis to drive global optimization and platform enhancements.




Preferred Experience:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Marketing, or a related field.
3-5 years of experience in Technical Account Management or Data Analysis, preferably in consulting and managing complex software solutions.
Strong technical background with expertise in ad-serving platforms, programmatic advertising, DMPs, and related technologies.
Experience or strong interest in the online marketing industry.
Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
Team player with a hands-on mentality and a drive to learn.
Sales and relationship-building skills.
Affinity for complex technical processes and tools.
Experience in data-driven marketing or programmatic advertising is a plus.
Fluency in written and spoken English.




Our Client is an Equal Opportunity Employer:

They celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. They strive to empower connection with one another, reflect the communities they serve, and tackle meaningful projects that make a real impact.




Next Steps:

If you are a highly motivated and skilled Data Analyst with a passion for the digital advertising space, we encourage you to apply. This is an excellent opportunity to join a growing company at the forefront of innovation. Please apply here!

Title: Data Analyst (H/F)
Description:
À propos de nous

Spécialisé dans l’accompagnement sous toutes ses formes, le Groupe Mentor a pour vocation la création, la reprise ou la prise de participation de sociétés dans le but d'en accélérer et d'en structurer le développement à horizon national et international.

Avec 7 secteurs d’activité, 15 pays couverts et 2000 collaborateurs, le groupe est une véritable ruche de savoir-faire.

Soucieux du bien-être de nos équipes, nous vous proposons un environnement de travail agréable et propice à l’entraide, dans un cadre verdoyant mais surtout avec des missions à forte valeur ajoutée.

Au-delà des compétences et des diplômes, nous recherchons des personnes motivées, enthousiastes et animées par l’envie de relever de nouveaux défis.

La variété de nos métiers et de nos secteurs d’activité crée un environnement de travail unique, favorisant la montée en compétence de nos collaborateurs ainsi que la possibilité d’évoluer en interne sur de nombreux postes !

Engagé pour la cause environnementale, le Groupe veille à la digitalisation, à la réduction des déchets, au recyclage et d'autres pratiques quotidiennes, en donnant l'exemple au siège et dans ses filiales.

Vous vous reconnaissez dans les valeurs du Groupe ? Nous recherchons un Data Analyst (H/F)

Mission

En tant que Data Analyst, vous serez chargé d'extraire des données (en l'absence de Data Engineer), de les analyser et de les interpréter pour aider le groupe et ses filiales à prendre des décisions éclairées. Vous collaborerez étroitement avec les équipes métiers pour comprendre leurs besoins en données, créer des rapports et des visualisations, et fournir des insights exploitables.

Vos Missions

1- Analyse de données


Effectuer des analyses descriptives et exploratoires pour identifier des tendances et des patterns
Utiliser des techniques statistiques pour interpréter les résultats


2- Reporting


Créer des rapports détaillés pour présenter les résultats des analyses
Développer et maintenir des tableaux de bord interactifs pour visualiser les données


3- Support aux équipes métiers


Collaborer avec les équipes métiers pour comprendre leurs besoins en données et fournir des insights pertinents
Aider à la formulation de recommandations basées sur les données


4- Automatisation et optimisation


Automatiser les processus de reporting pour en améliorer l'efficacité
Optimiser les flux de travail d'analyse des données


5- Documentation


Documenter les méthodologies d'analyse et les processus de reporting
Maintenir une base de connaissances sur les meilleures pratiques en analyse de données


Profil

Diplôme

BAC+5 en Statistiques, Mathématiques, Informatique Économie ou domaine connexe

Vos Compétences Techniques


Python, R, SQL
Tableau, Power BI, Qlik
Statistiques et mathématiques


Analytiques


Interprétation des ensembles de données, extraction d'insight
Résolution de problèmes, pensée critique


Communication


Excellentes compétences en communication orale et écrite
Capacité à présenter des informations techniques de manière claire et concise aux parties non techniques (vulgarisation)


Organisationnelles


Gestion de projet et priorités simultanément
Attention aux détails et souci de la précision


Qualités Personnelles


Curiosité, désir d'apprendre, esprit analytique et rigoureux
Capacité à travailler en équipe et de manière autonome
Adaptabilité et flexibilité


Référence de l'offre : 3kqvjbr0o8

La variété de nos métiers et de nos secteurs d’activité crée un environnement de travail unique, favorisant la montée en compétence de nos collaborateurs ainsi que la possibilité d’évoluer en interne sur de nombreux postes !

Engagé pour la cause environnementale, le Groupe veille à la digitalisation, à la réduction des déchets, au recyclage et d'autres pratiques quotidiennes, en donnant l'exemple au siège et dans ses filiales.

Vous vous reconnaissez dans les valeurs du Groupe ? Nous recherchons un Data Analyst (H/F)

Mission

En tant que Data Analyst, vous serez chargé d'extraire des données (en l'absence de Data Engineer), de les analyser et de les interpréter pour aider le groupe et ses filiales à prendre des décisions éclairées. Vous collaborerez étroitement avec les équipes métiers pour comprendre leurs besoins en données, créer des rapports et des visualisations, et fournir des insights exploitables.

Vos Missions

1- Analyse de données

  • Effectuer des analyses descriptives et exploratoires pour identifier des tendances et des patterns
  • Utiliser des techniques statistiques pour interpréter les résultats

2- Reporting

  • Créer des rapports détaillés pour présenter les résultats des analyses
  • Développer et maintenir des tableaux de bord interactifs pour visualiser les données

3- Support aux équipes métiers

  • Collaborer avec les équipes métiers pour comprendre leurs besoins en données et fournir des insights pertinents
  • Aider à la formulation de recommandations basées sur les données

4- Automatisation et optimisation

  • Automatiser les processus de reporting pour en améliorer l'efficacité
  • Optimiser les flux de travail d'analyse des données

5- Documentation

  • Documenter les méthodologies d'analyse et les processus de reporting
  • Maintenir une base de connaissances sur les meilleures pratiques en analyse de données

Profil

Diplôme

BAC+5 en Statistiques, Mathématiques, Informatique Économie ou domaine connexe

Vos Compétences Techniques

  • Python, R, SQL
  • Tableau, Power BI, Qlik
  • Statistiques et mathématiques

Analytiques

  • Interprétation des ensembles de données, extraction d'insight
  • Résolution de problèmes, pensée critique

Communication

  • Excellentes compétences en communication orale et écrite
  • Capacité à présenter des informations techniques de manière claire et concise aux parties non techniques (vulgarisation)

Organisationnelles

  • Gestion de projet et priorités simultanément
  • Attention aux détails et souci de la précision

Qualités Personnelles

  • Curiosité, désir d'apprendre, esprit analytique et rigoureux
  • Capacité à travailler en équipe et de manière autonome
  • Adaptabilité et flexibilité

Référence de l'offre : 3kqvjbr0o8

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Seleccionamos Consultor Power BI Jpara incorporar a nuestras oficinas de Vic.

Vilar Riba somos una organización de asesoramiento global en los ámbitos fiscal, legal, laboral, consultoría, auditoria y M&A. Contamos con un equipo de más de 175 profesionales especializados y con una trayectoria de más de 30 años de experiencia. También formamos parte de la red Geneva Group Internacional (GGI) la sexta firma mundial de servicios profesionales a empresas.




Principales funciones

-Participar en proyectos de definición e implantación de cuadros de mando para las distintas áreas de la empresa mediante la utilización de las herramientas Business Intelligence de Microsoft Power BI.

-Obtención de datos, análisis y procesamiento de los mismos.

-Analizar y definir estrategia e identificar nuevas oportunidades de negocio.

-Comunicación constante con cliente para la toma de requerimientos, validación y soporte en la utilización.







Requisitos

-Formación de ingeniería informática, ingeniería industrial, grado en tecnología y empresa o grado en química o ADE.

-3 años de experiencia en Proyectos de Business Intelligence.

-Experiencia en MS Power BI, lenguaje DAX, configuración de Data Gateway y funcionalidades de PowerQuery.

-Perfil analítico, dinámico y riguroso, acostumbrado a manejar y analizar indicadores de gestión de negocio.

Valorable buen nivel de inglés.




Ofrecemos

-Proyección profesional basada en la continua adquisición de conocimientos y experiencia participando en proyectos en organizaciones de primer nivel.

-Excelente ambiente de trabajo.

-Formar parte de un equipo joven, motivado y altamente especializado.

-Asumir responsabilidades con clientes.

-Formación:

-Técnica y en idiomas.

-Personalizada a tus necesidades.

-Plan de Conciliación.

-Modelo de teletrabajo híbrido.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About the Company




Safetykleen is a leading provider of Parts Washing, Waste Collection and Environmental Advisory services to businesses. Our operations encompass 12 European countries in addition to Brazil and Turkey. We have 19 branches across UK and Ireland, employing circ. 600 passionate and committed people. We are built on a strong business model, a winning culture and always putting customer at the heart of everything we do.




We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team and support the Sales & Marketing strategy through data analysis. If you have experience with ERP, BI (Power BI), and SQL, this could be the perfect opportunity for you!




About the Role

What You’ll Do:




Extract and analyze data from our ERP, BI, and other sources to provide actionable insights
Build dashboards, reports, and KPIs to support decision-making
Identify trends and patterns in Sales, Marketing, and Customer data
Automate and optimize recurring reports to improve efficiency
Work closely with the commercial team to support business objectives




Responsibilities

Proven experience as a Data Analyst, preferably working with ERP system
Hands-on experience with BI tools (Power BI or similar) and SQL
Strong analytical mindset, able to deep dive into data and see the bigger picture
Fluent in Portuguese & English
The role requires a highly analytical person




What we Offer




Attractive salary package
Excellent team environment and workplace culture
Comprehensive insurance coverage
Competitive salary + daily meal allowance
Annual performance-based bonus

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
A Job? Or a Lifetime Experience? Start Yours Here!




We are a Portuguese technology consulting company with a strong outward look to the rest of Europe. We have 10 years of experience in the market and reached the status of “large company” in 2018. We now have more than 350 associates and we keep growing, with offices in Lisbon, Porto, and Leiria, as well as projects in more than 20 countries. Our company is part of the national top 10, with a growth of 250% in the last years.




Work-life balance is part of our DNA. We focus on win-win-win relationships, defining every moment of interaction as an experience with unique conditions. Working with Affinity is a “Lifetime Experience” where you will have the opportunity to demonstrate all your potential and to be successful on every level.




#welcometoyourfuture




What you need to have/know:




Write SQL queries to extract and manipulate data from relational databases.
Work with different database engines (SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL, etc.).
Optimize queries to improve report performance.
Create interactive visualizations and dashboards in Power BI.
Strong experience in ETL processes and financial reporting using Microsoft technologies and relational databases such as PostgreSQL, SQL Server, and MySQL.
Experience in data ingestion and migration of legacy systems to next-generation platforms like Dremio, with analytics using BI tools, preferably Power BI.
Desirable experience in leadership and collaborating with cross-functional data teams, with expertise in both backend and frontend.




What will encourage you




Being part of a company that has a disruptive action in the technology market;
Being part of a technology focused on relationships, simplicity, and efficiency;
Accessing a generative career directly proportional to your performance and interest;
The real possibility of being part of our company staff.




Apply and Join Us!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Procuras dar um passo na tua carreira nas áreas de IT e Telecomunicações?

Então chegaste ao sítio certo – à Smart!

A tecnologia, a transformação e a inovação fazem parte do nosso ADN. Somos uma empresa de consultoria tecnológica com mais de uma década de experiência no desenvolvimento de projetos nacionais e internacionais em IT e Telecomunicações e queremos fazer parte da tua história.

O que precisas para ser um SMART (INDICAR VAGA)?

Licenciatura em Engenharia Informática, Informática de Gestão ou similar
Mínimo de 2 anos de experiência em análise de dados.
Proficiência comprovada na ferramenta de Power BI, incluindo desenvolvimento de dashboards e relatórios.
Conhecimento em desenvolvimento de modelos tabulares será valorizado.
Capacidade de traduzir necessidades de negócios em especificações técnicas.
Excelentes habilidades de comunicação e apresentação, com a habilidade de se comunicar eficazmente em todos os níveis da organização.

Quais serão as tuas funções na SMART?

Colaborar com as partes interessadas dos diversos setores para identificar e entender suas necessidades e desafios analíticos específicos.
Mapear os requisitos de negócio para as funcionalidades do produto de analytics existente, identificando oportunidades de melhoria e personalização.
Desenvolver e manter dashboards e relatórios usando o Power BI para fornecer insights acionáveis.
Garantir a qualidade e a integridade dos dados utilizados para a análise.
Trabalhar em estreita colaboração com as equipas de desenvolvimento de produtos para comunicar as necessidades dos utilizadores e influenciar a estratégia de produto.

Porquê ser SMART?

Tornamos reais os projetos em que participamos.
Amamos o que fazemos e temos orgulho no resultado do nosso trabalho.
Somos simples e eficientes.
Valorizamos as nossas pessoas.
Somos uma equipa dinâmica, íntegra e de confiança.

Onde podes ser SMART?

Lisboa.

Title: Business Intelligence
HTML:
A Job? Or a Lifetime Experience? Start Yours Here!


A nossa missão é ser uma parte significativa da carreira das nossas pessoas. À medida que crescemos, cresce também a determinação em oferecer a melhor experiência aos nossos colaboradores e clientes e é exatamente isso que nos move. Somos uma empresa portuguesa de consultoria tecnológica com escritórios em Lisboa, Porto e Óbidos e representações no Brasil e Tunísia. Contamos com mais de 12 anos de expertise no mercado, e hoje somos um universo de cerca de 400 pessoas a trabalhar em contexto presencial, remoto ou híbrido em projetos em mais de 20 países.


Acreditamos que grandes pessoas fazem empresas de sucesso e por isso mesmo defendemos a valorização, reconhecimento e crescimento dos nossos profissionais.


Não queremos ser mais uma linha do teu CV, queremos que connosco vivas uma Lifetime Experience. Apostamos em formações e certificações que confirmam a tua real progressão, na promoção de um saudável work-life balance e na oferta de benefícios com impacto na tua vida pessoal e carreira.


O que procuramos

  • Formação superior em Engenharia Informática ou similar (valorizado);
  • Experiência em Business Intelligence em Tecnologia Microsoft;
  • Bons conhecimentos de Power BI;
  • Bons conhecimentos de processos ETL;
  • Bons conhecimentos de Inglês (B2/C1)


Ser Affinity

#Affinidade – Criares relações de proximidade e empatia com colegas, clientes e candidatos (e não apenas com tecnologias, linguagens e plataformas). Espírito de equipa e boa disposição;

#Ambição – Quereres fazer mais e melhor. Vontade de exceder expectativas e evoluir pessoal e profissionalmente;

#Ação – Energia para fazer acontecer. Mostrares proatividade e capacidade de iniciativa;

#Aprendizagem – Vontade de evoluir individual e coletivamente e tornares-te um expert no mercado tecnológico.


A tua #LifetimeExperience

  • Participar em projetos nacionais e internacionais numa empresa baseada em relacionamentos pessoais, na simplicidade e na eficiência, com uma ação disruptiva no mercado tecnológico;
  • Aceder a um plano de carreira e formação personalizado e diretamente proporcional ao teu desempenho e interesse;
  • Fazer parte de um ambiente acolhedor, de confiança, respeito e informalidade;
  • Integrar as nossas Affinity Communities (de desporto, tecnologia, hobbies, etc.) e participar ativamente em projetos de responsabilidade social e ambiental;
  • Tirar partido de um conjunto de benefícios, parcerias, descontos eventos e dinâmicas internas.


Para além da tua satisfação profissional queremos proporcionar-te oportunidades de lazer e convívio memoráveis e dignos de uma experiência Affinity.


Join the Experience!


Envia-nos a tua candidatura e aproveita para nos conhecer e ir acompanhando em:


https://www.instagram.com/affinityportugal/

https://www.linkedin.com/company/2701281/admin/

https://twitter.com/WithAffinity

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At ING we are looking for a Data Analyst




Your role and work environment:




We are looking for a talented and enthusiastic Data Analyst to join our Data Analyst team of Customer Interactions and Monetization Tribe.




Our mission is to enhance business performance through descriptive analytics and business diagnosis, providing insights and recommendations that facilitate better decision-making and lead to improved commercial outcomes.




We seek a dynamic and proactive individual who can engage with business areas, comprehend their needs, understand their services and products, and navigate the data ecosystem to produce precise and meaningful data-driven analyses.




We value a strong and honest team spirit, fostering an excellent and collaborative environment with business stakeholders and your fellow Data Analysts. This contributes to a robust and highly skilled data analyst community.




Your key responsibilities:




As a Data Analyst, you will:




Engage proactively with business areas to understand their business goals, financial services and products, to generate accurate data-driven business analyses and recommendations.

Analyzing product trends to increase sales conversion, reduce product attrition, improve digital funnels, and support communication campaigns. This involves identifying key performance indicators, monitoring product performance, and suggesting actionable insights to optimize sales strategies and customer experience.

Conducting customer analyses to determine customer lifetime value, customer segmentation, and forecast customer development. This includes using analytical techniques to identify patterns and trends in customer data, enabling the business to tailor its marketing and retention strategies effectively.

Supporting and advising the business on reporting needs and other analytical requirements. This entails collaborating with stakeholders to define reporting metrics, coordinate the development of comprehensive dashboards to ensure data-driven business monitoring and decision-making.




Additionally, you will collaborate closely with your Data Analyst teammates to foster a robust and highly skilled data analyst community. This involves sharing best practices, participating in knowledge-sharing sessions, and contributing to a culture of continuous improvement and excellence.







What are we looking for?




Want to know if this job is made for you? These are some of the qualities that we value the most for this role. And if the shoe fits… don’t hesitate to apply!




Willing to assume challenges, take initiative and personal responsibility.

Desirable thinking in strategic terms. Able to recognize key information, identify business opportunities, establish connections and apply analytics for decision-making.

Willing to learn and improve your technical and your interpersonal skills.

Diven and customer-focused, always striving to understand and meet the needs of the business and its clients.

Bachelor’s degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics, or other degree with strong analytical content.

Full proficiency in Excel, SAS and SQL

At least 5 years of experience in a comparable role, transforming data to extract key business insights. Experience in retail banking is highly recommended

Your communication skills enable you to work together with many different parties throughout our organization. Negotiation and stakeholder management

Fluent English will be appreciated.







What do we offer?




The time you spend at work, the challenges you face or the lessons you get are very important, but… What about your personal life? At ING we want your work to fulfill you in every way, and that is why we take care of even the smallest details.




Check out what is waiting for you!




Be flexible my friend.

Our model is all about flexibility and accountability. Keeping both our customers and our colleagues needs in mind, you determine together which days you work at home and which you come to ING MAD to offer your best self. Do your thing.

Restaurant card.

So that thinking about what to have for lunch doesn’t take up your time or your cravings.

Our house will be your home.

In our offices you can find electric mobility solutions, doctor, hairdresser, gym, The Good Service (to help you with your errands) and much more!

Health insurance.

For you and all your family (spouse/partner and children).




Life insurance.

We help you protect what matters most to you.

Flexible remuneration.

In addition, you will enjoy our flexible remuneration model, through a more tax-advantaged way, you will be able to access other services such as nursery, transport card, training aids…

Free company shuttle.

It doesn't matter where you live. We have 6 routes (North, Central, South, A5, A42 and A6) to get you to our ING office in Madrid comfortably.

Banking benefits.

Special loans with more beneficial conditions.

Special mortgage conditions after 6 months working at the bank.

And you can benefit from our pension plan after 1 month with us!

More vitality and more belonging

360º care of the employee (physical, mental, social connection & purpose).

Physiotherapy service on site.

Runners club with your own trainer.

Clinics with professional, world-class athletes.

Gympass service.

Employee Networks: Rainbow Lions (LGBTQI+) & Leonas.







Get to know Us




We are a team of more than 1600 people sharing one idea: doing our bit in helping our clients create a better future for themselves, by providing them with the tools they need to get where they want to go.




A fully online bank where technology, innovation, simplicity and transparency are the main ingredients, and the first one to work with agile methodologies.




And although we are based in Spain, we are lucky to work in an international bank with presence in more than 40 countries.




We are proud to have a diverse team and we are committed to continue developing a culture of Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging to foster a culture of collaboration and innovation that represents all collectives in the society.




And even though we look orange on the outside, we are green on the inside. Our ambition in Sustainability is Empowering (y)our Sustainability journey. We are embarking on our path, for us, but we are also there for when our clients decide to embark on this journey.




Making things happen, helping others be successful, always being one step ahead—that’s our DNA. If you look at yourself in the mirror and your reflection matches our way of being and working…we are looking forward to meeting you!

Free company shuttle.

It doesn't matter where you live. We have 6 routes (North, Central, South, A5, A42 and A6) to get you to our ING office in Madrid comfortably.

Banking benefits.

Special loans with more beneficial conditions.

Special mortgage conditions after 6 months working at the bank.

And you can benefit from our pension plan after 1 month with us!

More vitality and more belonging

360º care of the employee (physical, mental, social connection & purpose).

Physiotherapy service on site.

Runners club with your own trainer.

Clinics with professional, world-class athletes.

Gympass service.

Employee Networks: Rainbow Lions (LGBTQI+) & Leonas.



Get to know Us


We are a team of more than 1600 people sharing one idea: doing our bit in helping our clients create a better future for themselves, by providing them with the tools they need to get where they want to go.


A fully online bank where technology, innovation, simplicity and transparency are the main ingredients, and the first one to work with agile methodologies.


And although we are based in Spain, we are lucky to work in an international bank with presence in more than 40 countries.


We are proud to have a diverse team and we are committed to continue developing a culture of Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging to foster a culture of collaboration and innovation that represents all collectives in the society.


And even though we look orange on the outside, we are green on the inside. Our ambition in Sustainability is Empowering (y)our Sustainability journey. We are embarking on our path, for us, but we are also there for when our clients decide to embark on this journey.


Making things happen, helping others be successful, always being one step ahead—that’s our DNA. If you look at yourself in the mirror and your reflection matches our way of being and working…we are looking forward to meeting you!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We offer:




• Join a best-in-class dynamic team that brings ideas, innovation and passion

• Work directly with senior management from various business units and support strategic objectives

• International, collaborative and creative environment

• Working on real business problems

• Contingent/Leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley

• Contract via 3rd party agency




Key Responsibilities:




• Establish strong work relationships with team members across Wealth Management functions to support strategic initiatives

• Work with Digital Client Experience Platform (DCEP) teams and analytics partners to define measurement strategy based on product analytics requirements

• Understand business needs and convert them to data collection technical requirements

• Utilize proactive problem-solving and innovative thinking to address challanges

• Build, review and monitor data models and conduct analysis based on specific requirrements

• Build data visualizations for reporting to senior management

• Provide analytics and insights for various business initiatives and projects

• Prepare and deliver presentations to highlight important metrics and showcase achievemnts




Qualifications:




• 0-3 years of business analytics experience or experience with digital tools

• Highly motivated, detail-oriented self-starter personality with a strong sense of ownership, accountability, willingness to learn, high degree of curiosity and desire to succeed

• Advanced written and verbal communications in English

• Strong analytical mindset

• Strong sense of identifying priorities

• The ability to handle multiple tasks and projects concurrently

• Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to determine business partner needs and create purpose built solutions

• The ability to work collaboratively across multiple business units, teams job functions and geographical locations

• At least Bachelor’s Degree




You might also have:




• Experience with SPSS, R, SQL, DataIku

• Knowledge / Experience in Analytics

• Hands on experience utilizing digital tools (Adobe Analytics, Power BI, Google Analytics, etc.)

• Data visualization experience (Tableau, QlikView etc)




Department Profile:




The Analytics & Data (A&D) organization is a key growth area within Morgan Stanley’s Wealth Management Division, playing a critical role in the execution of the wider Wealth Management strategy. The use of analytics and data will be a key driver in accelerating growth across all client segments, enabling data-driven decision making and delivering the best client experience.




Team Profile:




The User Experience Data Collection Team is part of the Wealth Management Analytics & Data Organization at Morgan Stanley. The team drives strategy and execution of platforms that collect quantitative and qualitative data about user experience across Wealth Management properties and activities. The team’s responsibility is to support Wealth Managements strategic objectives through the use and exploitation of its data and analytical assets and manage digital surveys across business units throughout Morgan Stanley Wealth Management.

Title: Data analyst F/H
Description:
About

Pour accompagner la mise en place du processus de planification des ventes et des opérations (Sales&Operation planning, S&OP), l’entité « cohérence stratégique » recherche un data analyst pour piloter et architecturer le référentiel data associé au S&OP et sa gouvernance, préparer les différentes reviews S&OP, suivre les indicateurs associés, et préparer des tableaux de bord de responsabilité « cohérence stratégique ».

En tant que data analyst, vous jouez un rôle clé dans la transformation de MBDA et sa capacité à prendre des décisions éclairées face aux défis géostratégiques actuels. Votre expertise permettra d’accompagner la croissance de l’entreprise et d’optimiser l’utilisation des données, notamment par le choix des outils et bases de données.

L’ Architecture / Gestion Des Données

En interface avec différentes directions (Sales, opérations, ingénierie, finance et IM) et les filiales de MBDA, vous aurez pour principales missions :

Structuration des différentes bases de données nécessaires au S&OP – définition des règles de gestion de structuration des différentes bases de données entre elles.

Gouvernance et architecture des données S&OP

Extraction des données nécessaires à l’analyse

Analyse des données

Définition des règles de gestion de nettoyage des bases de données

Maîtrise de la qualité des données tout au long de leur traitement.

Outil S&OP

Rédaction des besoins outil S&OP, test et recettes

Simulation de scénarios sur la base des données collectées et fiabilisées

Evaluation desdits scénarios

Processus S&OP

Préparation des « demand review », des « supply review » des « S&OP review » et du cascading des décisions prises en S&OP

Suivi des plans d’actions définis en fonction des simulations réalisées

Préparation et automatisation des tableaux de bords permettant notamment la mise en place de plans d’amélioration continue

Veille technologique sur les outils d’analyse de données

Effectuer une veille sur les nouvelles technologies et solutions logicielles d’analyse des données

Rechercher et expérimenter de nouvelles méthodes de modélisation et d’analyse des données

Sélectionner les nouveaux outils et techniques d’analyse des données

De formation Ingénieur ou équivalent, vous disposez d’une première expérience réussie dans le développement de solutions analytiques, dans un contexte industriel.

Vous avez grâce à vos compétences en gestion de projet, développé des compétences en IT, Data Analytique, Statistique qui vous permettent d’être à l’aise dans la construction de KPIs, dans la modélisation de la donnée, et dans l’utilisation des outils de Business Intelligence (Power BI, SAC, Qlikview …).

Vous disposez d’une maitrise des langages VBA et SQL et idéalement d’une connaissance de l’environnement SAP (SAP3, SAP4). Anglais courant souhaité.

Interfacer avec tous niveaux d’interlocuteurs métiers de l’entreprise dans le groupe

Rôle clé lors de présentations destinées notamment au CoDiR

Contexte International

Nice-to-have skills


Data Analytics
Statistics
Data Modeling
Business Intelligence
Power BI
SAP
VBA
SQL
Le Plessis-Robinson, Île-de-France, France


Work experience


Data Analyst


Languages


French
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Cassà de la Selva, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
¿Deseas unirte a una compañía donde las personas son lo primero?




Eurofirms Group es la primera empresa nacional de Recursos Humanos. Desde hace más de 30 años, hemos consolidado un modelo de gestión por valores en el sector de Recursos Humanos, basado en tres pilares fundamentales: Personas-PeopleFirst, Innovación y Excelencia.




Somos una empresa orientada a las personas, con buen ambiente de trabajo y con responsabilidad social.




En Eurofirms Group creemos en el talento único de cada persona y sabemos que la diversidad aporta valor a los equipos, impulsando organizaciones más innovadoras, creativas y eficientes. Por eso, de acuerdo con nuestra cultura People first, trabajamos para generar entornos laborales inclusivos en los que cada individuo pueda crecer y desarrollar su mejor versión. Asimismo, buscamos actuar como agentes de cambio para promover la igualdad de oportunidades en nuestro entorno, fomentando el respeto y apostando por la diversidad en todas sus formas.

Seas como seas y sientas como sientas, en Eurofirms Group tendrás un sitio para brillar.




¿Deseas unirte a una empresa que crece y evoluciona constantemente?




Seleccionamos a Data Analyst para formar parte del área de IT de Eurofirms situada en CIS (Corporate Internal Services) en Cassà de la Selva (Girona), con posibilidad de trabajar desde nuestra oficina de Barcelona.




Retribución en función de los valores aportados.




¿Qué harás?

Tu misión principal será la de habilitar la toma de decisiones de negocio informadas mediante datos e información.

Entre tus funciones, te ocuparás de las siguientes tareas:

Diseñar una solución basada en datos a las preguntas de negocio planteadas.
Trabajar con el resto del equipo de datos (Data Engineers y Data Scientists) para implementar las soluciones propuestas.
Elaborar informes y cuadros de mando mediante herramientas de Business Intelligence, destinados a las demás funciones de negocio que consuman la información.
Realizar extracciones de datos a medida que responden a necesidades puntuales de información.




¿Qué esperamos de ti?

Buscamos una persona con una buena comunicación y buena capacidad de escucha, con atención al detalle y orientado al servicio. Alguien proactivo y autónomo.




Aptitudes necesarias

Interlocución con diversos niveles organizativos y diversas áreas funcionales.
Capacidad de traducir del lenguaje de negocio al técnico y viceversa.
Pensamiento estratégico y orientado a sistemas.
Interpretar y asimilar información fragmentada.
Construir historias relevantes a partir de la información contenida en los datos.




Requisitos

Herramientas y conceptos de Business Intelligence (Microsoft, Tableau, QlikSense o similares)
Herramientas de scripting en herramientas de Business Intelligence (SSAS, DAX, Qlik scripting…)
Conocimientos de visualización de datos y visual storytelling (Power BI, Informes SSRS o similares)
Conceptos de modelado de datos e información
Bases de datos y SQL
Hojas de cálculo y tablas dinámicas (Excel)




Se valorará

Aportar experiencia en herramientas de ETL (SSIS, Power Query, Talend, Informatica Power Center, …)
Tener conocimientos adicionales de programación.
Idioma inglés.




¿Qué ventajas tiene trabajar en una empresa People first?

En Eurofirms Group te ofrecemos el mejor entorno y condiciones para que puedas brillar tanto en tu vida profesional como en la personal.




Un trabajo que hace de la conciliación una realidad

Tarde libre semanal
Retribución flexible para ahorrar en tus gastos de manutención, transporte, guardería o seguro médico a través de Cobee




Tu salud, y la de los tuyos, es lo primero

Mutua de salud gratuita y con descuentos para tu familia, a partir de los 2 años en Eurofirms
Descuentos en la cuota de múltiples gimnasios, entrenamientos personales, nutrición y salud mental disponibles en la app Wellhub.




A tu lado en los momentos especiales

Día libre el día de tu cumpleaños




Si te apasiona el mundo de la innovación y la tecnología, esta es tu oportunidad para crecer en la primera empresa nacional de recursos humanos. ¡Únete a nuestro equipo EurofirmsIT!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst / Power BI
Description:
We are searching for a Data Analyst / Power BI to strengthen our Microsoft-Team! To join them in working on new upcoming projects.




LACO is a Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company that exist for more than 35 years now. We are a Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner with extensive expertise in various areas, including Microsoft BI and Data Governance. With over 120 consultants, we are dedicated to helping businesses succeed with data. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do.




At LACO, we value long-term relationships with both our clients and colleagues. We have recently secured several large projects with key clients, and to support these, we are looking to strengthen our Microsoft team to deliver end-to-end projects alongside the LACO team.




YOUR JOB

As a Data Analyst/Power BI Expert at LACO, you’ll be responsible for:

Understanding and mapping out the requirements of the business.
Collecting, cleaning and pre-processing data from various sources.
Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI to create compelling visualizations and reports.
Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Troubleshooting and resolving issues with Power BI reports, transforming complex data sets into meaningful insights through the creation of data visualizations.
Staying up to date with the latest Power BI Microsoft Fabric features and best practices to excel in this role.




YOUR SKILLS

You have a Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degree in computer science or equivalent.
You have an analytical mindset.
You have at least 3 years proven experience as a Power BI Developer or a similar role.
You know all about the programming languages SQL, DAX and Python.
You can model data using Kimball, Dimensional Modelling and Data Vault.
You are proficient in Power BI, including DAX, data modelling and custom visuals.




You get even more bonus points if …

You have a good knowledge of Azure Synapse, Data Factory, and Databricks.
You are familiar with diverse types of data storage for structured data.
You are a strong communicator with teamwork abilities.
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.




OUR OFFER

We’re open to work with Employees and Freelancers
Receive an attractive salary package, along with excellent benefits.
Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
Be involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, …




Don’t let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our Talent Acquisition team and embark on your adventure to success.

Show more
